room_type: Sands Premier Double Queen City View Room

review_text:
💝 Unforgettable memories and impressions that will stay with us for the rest of our lives! 💝
🎶 Eunice Marasigan welcomed us and surrounded us with such care. You will be in our memory for a long time! 
Do I need to write that this hotel is a symbol of Singapore? Is it necessary to describe the delight of the view from the observation deck and from the pool? You need to see this with your own eyes, because the photo does not convey even half of the beauty that the eye sees.
💸 It is expensive. 💸
☺️ Marina Bay Sands is my dream come true. I hope I can come back again. 😇

room_type: Sands Premier Double Queen Gardens By The Bay View
review_text:
We stayed for three nights (4 days), it took a long time to choose a room. As a result, we rented a room with a view of the gardens, and we didn't regret it. I liked: we lived on the 32nd floor, the room had a balcony, the noise of the city was audible, but not annoying. The view from the balcony was relaxing, it's nice to sit and admire in the evening.  The room was spacious, as was the bathroom. The cosmetics were wonderful!!! Coffee, sweets and tea were delicious! It's unnecessary to write about the pool)), it's the icing on the cake. If you arrive early, you can go to the pool, it is very comfortable there.  We didn't have breakfast, after reading the reviews that it was easier to have a snack somewhere nearby. I can't say that there are a lot of "eateries" nearby. Perhaps I would have bought breakfast next time. The transport accessibility is excellent, you can enter the subway from the hotel. 
everything interesting is nearby. If there is an opportunity to stay there, you should do it))

review_text: The cleaning lady gives snacks to the children, which is greatly appreciated, and the cleaning is also very thorough. Since we have a four-year-old child staying, we hope that next time a step stool for the child can be provided, as their height is not sufficient.

room_type: Sands Premier Suite King Gardens By The Bay View
review_text:
Every member of the Marina Bay Sands team we encountered went above and beyond, turning what could have been just another hotel stay into an unforgettable experience filled with care, comfort, and heart.

A minor accident during our stay—when our daughter tripped over the carpet and had a nosebleed—was handled with exemplary care. The staff member from Express Service prioritized her safety and promptly coordinated housekeeping to assist us. The housekeeping lady who came to help was so humble and kind, even declining a tip for her hard work.

Special recognition also goes to Service Management Team, Ms. Ella Barrientos, who followed up with a compassionate call, offered a thoughtful gift to cheer up our daughter, and even took care of cleaning her top. The warmth and humanity she showed meant so much to us, and we would also like to thank the laundry team for their assistance in removing the blood stain so efficiently.

Our children’s first visit to Singapore has become a treasured memory thanks to the hotel’s exceptional hospitality.
review_translated:
Every member of the Marina Bay Sands team we encountered went above and beyond, turning what could have been just another hotel stay into an unforgettable experience filled with care, comfort, and heart.

The staff member from Express Service prioritized her safety and promptly coordinated housekeeping to assist us. The housekeeping lady who came to help was so humble and kind, even declining a tip for her hard work.

Special recognition also goes to Service Management Team, Ms. Ella Barrientos, who followed up with a compassionate call, offered a thoughtful gift to cheer up our daughter, and even took care of cleaning her top. The warmth and humanity she showed meant so much to us, and we would also like to thank the laundry team for their assistance in removing the blood stain so efficiently.

Our children’s first visit to Singapore has become a treasured memory thanks to the hotel’s exceptional hospitality.

review_text: Very good experience, thanks to the front desk girl named Sandy. She was very gentle and helped us upgrade to a suite for free.
review_translated: Very good experience, thanks to the front desk girl named Sandy. She was very gentle and helped us upgrade to a suite for free.

review_text: We had a truly wonderful stay at this hotel! From the moment we arrived, the staff made us feel so welcomed and cared for. The service was exceptional—friendly, accommodating, and always with a smile. The room was clean, comfortable, and had everything I needed for a relaxing stay. The ambiance of the hotel felt warm and inviting, making it feel like a home away from home. I’m very grateful for such a pleasant experience and would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone looking for a great place to stay. I’ll surely be back again!

The service was exceptional—friendly, accommodating, and always with a smile. The room was clean, comfortable, and had everything I needed for a relaxing stay. The ambiance of the hotel felt warm and inviting, making it feel like a home away from home. I’m very grateful for such a pleasant experience and would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone looking for a great place to stay. I’ll surely be back again!

room_type: Sands Bay Suite King Gardens By The Bay View
review_text: Excellent new renovations in the rooms, functional amenities at the highest level: furniture, design, layout, everything is meticulously thought out (sorry other hotels! but you all should stop by here to see for yourselves). The pool and dining are also top-notch. The only downside is the queues at breakfast, even in the executive club, and the staff there, that sometimes forget about you(( But overall, the service is excellent, and it starts literally from the moment you step off the plane. That’s why my rating is a solid 'excellent'.

room_type: Sands Bay Suite King Gardens By The Bay View
review_text: Very very overrated hotel, don't trust the Instagram hype.  The ceilings are very low for a hotel of this calibre so all the rooms felt small and claustrophobic.  Booked an 81sq meter suite and it felt tiny so I asked the front desk and they said the 81sq meters included the balcony and walls.  Who does that?  There were two TVs in the room and one of them wasn't functioning properly.  This is a $2000 SGD a night room mind you.  Room service was below average, really not 5 star standards.  Service overall was excellent however but that does not make up for the low ceilings and tiny rooms that they advertise as big.  Disappointing overall experience and would not stay here again in the future.
review_translated: Very very overrated hotel, don't trust the Instagram hype.  The ceilings are very low for a hotel of this calibre so all the rooms felt small and claustrophobic.  Booked an 81sq meter suite and it felt tiny so I asked the front desk and they said the 81sq meters included the balcony and walls.  Who does that?  There were two TVs in the room and one of them wasn't functioning properly.  This is a $2000 SGD a night room mind you.  Room service was below average, really not 5 star standards.  Service overall was excellent however but that does not make up for the low ceilings and tiny rooms that they advertise as big.  Disappointing overall experience and would not stay here again in the future.

room_type: Sands Premier Double Queen Gardens By The Bay View
review_text:
Overall was really good! The view and the equipments are surely wonderful. But there’s a flaw that really upsets me:( we went to the Rise Restaurant for breakfast at 9:30, but we waited for approximately 30 minutes in line, it was fine to wait because it’s spring break. After we get into the restaurant and have some fruits, the restaurant started to clean all the food at 10:00, which we just get into the restaurant. (there are some food left at the bar but with NO tableware)
If the kitchen has their standard time to clean shouldn’t the staff told us…? They just let us in and started to clean all the food…which cost us SGD127.4 for breakfast and we ate NOTHING!

review_text: We expected the service to be average considering the scale of the hotel and how crowded it was. However we were pleasantly surprised. Their room service was quick and spot on. room_type: Sands Premier King Gardens By The Bay View
review_text: We were upgraded to a suite for no reason whatsoever other than Cedric at check in was an absolute gem🤩.  My daughter and I absolutely loved the room with every amenity one could need plus some.  We each had our own room with large screen televisions. We each had our own sink/mirror to get ready at as well a vanity/walk in closet area. As 2 traveling women this was truly a luxury. Our view of the winter wonderland/ gardens by the bay was unbeatable as was the view of the harbor filled with ships.  We had a small stocked bar as well as a tea cupboard with a porcelain tea set.  Prices for in room amenities - such as the alcohol, tea and array of snacks was no more expensive than purchasing at a store surprisingly.  Our stay and experience, we felt, was far worth the expense!

review_text: The overall service of the hotel was excellent. They welcome us with complimentary chocolates when we told them we were there to have an early birthday celebration for my wife. They sent their staff to help us when we could not connect our mobile phone to the TV. Not forgetting the excellent views from infinity swimming pool and room. They made the stay pleasant for us. However, they could improve on telling guests how to get to the Skypark. The staff of the club were not too friendly when we lost our way and asked for directions.

review_text: Place was super clean. Staff were all nice, helpful and supportive. Room wasn’t ready to check in at 300 so was given a free upgrade and added an hour to check out following morning. I’ll forever remember my time here. If you are in Singapore you have to go to Marina Bay Sands or you will miss a cherished memory.

review_text: We got there around noon and were  upgraded to a suite, which is worth almost twice as much as our original room! Our luggage was held until our room was ready, which was right after we finished talking with the receptionist, Catherine. My wife and I proceeded to walk to the Cloud Forest and Flower Dome, eating some delicious laksa in between at the dinosaur food court. Getting to our room for the first time was amazing! Huge bedroom, tv, bathroom, and balcony! The rooftop pool and jacuzzi were awesome too with a DJ and light shows below! Singapore slings and room service were delectable and the bed was very comfortable!

review_text: We came to Marina Bay Sands hotel mainly for the famous Infinity Pool and we really loved the Infinity Pool! It was very safe and the view was beautiful! The hotel also had many other attractions that was amazing! The hotel is located in a perfect spot! If you just cross a road, there is a shopping mall perfect for dining if you want to go and eat outside and if you want to ride the metro, just simply walk for about three minutes. Something that I also really love is how good the room is! The room was massive, high tech and clean of course. I have not seen a cleaner clean my room but I have peeked inside other rooms that the cleaner was cleaning and I saw just how hard the cleaners try to clean the hotel rooms! Everything was so good and comfortable and clean! The view from inside a room and a window was spectacular! Everything went perfect including how nice the staffs were. Next time I come back to Singapore which will not be too long, I definitely want to come and stay in Marina Bay Sands Hotel again! I had the best time here and I strongly recommend this hotel if you come to Singapore.

I had the best time here and I strongly recommend this hotel if you come to Singapore.

review_text:
Okay, we all know why you are here. You are thinking of booking a room at what is considered one of the best hotels in Singapore…maybe even the world, and you are skeptical because maybe it’s overhyped, overpriced and overpraised.
Well, I had all those worries, and I’m here to tell you…
….
….
This is the best hotel in Singapore. It might even be top 5 in the world.
The reviews and praises are legit.
I was so astonished with the hotel, it exceeded my expectations greatly.
The view is the most breathtaking view (if you hate heights, maybe it’s not for you, or pick a lower floor, or close the blinds)
It feels like you are on an adventure with the amount of activity you get to do.
And yes, the infinity pool is stunning, you literally feel like you are on the edge of the world.
This hotel is so good, one can take it as a bucket list item.
Quite expensive, but if you ever want to spoil yourself, you can book a night here. You can also just visit the hotel and enjoy most things without staying at it, but pool accesss is strictly for guests.
Overall, best hotel experience of my life, wonderful staff, beautiful rooms, magical experience.
10/10

review_text: This a beautiful hotel however the overall service was quite poor compared to other 5 star hotels in Singapore. Check in process is long averaging at 15-20mins and in my case i had to wait for an extra 20mins for a room to be available. Navigating the  hotel itself is quite hectic as its full of people who are not hotel guests. The only thing i enjoyed was the infinity pool which does get quite busy as well.

review_text:
It was a great pleasure to have a night stay at Marina Bay Sands. The ambiance was filled with elegance, complemented by stunning decorations. The hotel staff was incredibly kind and attentive, showing genuine concern for the guests' comfort and satisfaction.

Furthermore, the room was beautifully adorned and offered a breathtaking view of the iconic attraction, the "Super Tree." Additionally, there was a mesmerizing night show featuring a splendid display of colorful lights illuminating the hotel.

The swimming pool was an extraordinary experience, one that will be cherished forever. Being able to enjoy the pool while surrounded by Singapore's world-class landscape was truly a once-in-a-lifetime opportunity. I felt immensely grateful to have had such an unforgettable experience.
review_translated:
It was a great pleasure to have a night stay at Marina Bay Sands. The ambiance was filled with elegance, complemented by stunning decorations. The hotel staff was incredibly kind and attentive, showing genuine concern for the guests' comfort and satisfaction.

Furthermore, the room was beautifully adorned and offered a breathtaking view of the iconic attraction, the "Super Tree." Additionally, there was a mesmerizing night show featuring a splendid display of colorful lights illuminating the hotel.

The swimming pool was an extraordinary experience, one that will be cherished forever. Being able to enjoy the pool while surrounded by Singapore's world-class landscape was truly a once-in-a-lifetime opportunity. I felt immensely grateful to have had such an unforgettable experience.

review_text:
Gorgeous room! And many thanks to the lady who checked us into the hotel for a free upgrade, providing us the newly decorated room with amazing view. All the service staffs are so warmhearted and always ready to give helping hands to the customers. 
The experience in Marina Bay Sands hotel is unforgettable and we will choose the hotel again if we get the chance to travel to the Singapore!

review_text: Came here to celebrate my husband birthday, it was a great night and awesome stay at Marina Bay Sands. Did received a complementary birthday brownie cake. It was an amazing hotel! review_text:
It’s our 2nd time in MBS yet this time we had fun. Checking-in we wait for 1 hour to get our room(coz its weekend) yet Rose still manage to give us the room we requested. 
Thanks to Sam (poolside food staff) for being accommodating and friendly when we ordered our food. And lastly, to Liang and Eyia (photobooth staff) for taking our pictures. Definitely be back with my family! Kudos to everyone! 👏🏻

review_text:
I stayed for 1 night. I visited Sky City View here on a honeymoon, and requests (high floor, no smoking room, king room, early check-in, late check-out, shower after check-out, anniversary, etc.) were not reflected at all. I was surprised to be given a smoking room upon check-in. you have to request it again at check-in, and I felt like I couldn't communicate with Trip.com and MBS. 
MBS manager also told me to talk to Trip.com... In a word, I'm disappointed.
review_translated:
I stayed for 1 night. I visited Sky City View here on a honeymoon, and requests (high floor, no smoking room, king room, early check-in, late check-out, shower after check-out, anniversary, etc.) were not reflected at all. I was surprised to be given a smoking room upon check-in. you have to request it again at check-in, and I felt like I couldn't communicate with Trip.com and MBS. 
MBS manager also told me to talk to Trip.com... In a word, I'm disappointed.

review_text: The hotel is massive, so it may not be your first choice if you prefer a more intimate experience. The rooms are very spacious and comfortable. The location is convenient, with walking access to Gardens by the Bay and the light show at the waterfront.

review_text: We stayed at the Marina bay Sands hotel for one night for our honeymoon.it’s a stunning hotel and the view from the infinity pool was worth every penny. I didn’t realise but there is also a jacuzzi on the opposite side of the infinity pool with a view of the gardens by the bay. The hotel staff were very helpful around the hotel and service was quick. They booked us in promptly and prior to the check in time as we had arrived early. The view from the deluxe garden view was outstanding. The room itself was spacious with one of the biggest tv in a hotel I have come across. I have only given 4 stars for the service as the room phone to request express service was not working. I had to phone via my mobile to get through to the service team to inform them. They did say someone will be on their way to review the phone but was not repaired/fix. Apart from that everything else was excellent. The breakfast has great vegetarian options to.

review_text:
My stay at Marina Bay Sands was an amazing experience. The hotel's exterior is awe-inspiring, but the moment I stepped inside, I was greeted with a sense of spaciousness and luxury, and I was excited to experience a special time.

The room was spacious and clean, and the windows offered a spectacular view of Singapore's cityscape and Marina Bay. The beauty of the night view was breathtaking, not only during the day but also at night—a truly luxurious experience you can only get here.

The highlight, however, was undoubtedly the rooftop infinity pool. The view from 200 meters above ground was breathtaking, and watching the sunset and night view while soaking in the pool was an unforgettable memory. The staff were also extremely attentive, and I felt at ease throughout my stay.

The hotel also has a wide selection of restaurants and shopping malls, so you could easily spend an entire day inside the hotel. If you're visiting Singapore, this is a one-of-a-kind hotel worth staying at at least once.
review_translated:
My stay at Marina Bay Sands was an amazing experience. The hotel's exterior is awe-inspiring, but the moment I stepped inside, I was greeted with a sense of spaciousness and luxury, and I was excited to experience a special time.

The room was spacious and clean, and the windows offered a spectacular view of Singapore's cityscape and Marina Bay. The beauty of the night view was breathtaking, not only during the day but also at night—a truly luxurious experience you can only get here.

The highlight, however, was undoubtedly the rooftop infinity pool. The view from 200 meters above ground was breathtaking, and watching the sunset and night view while soaking in the pool was an unforgettable memory. The staff were also extremely attentive, and I felt at ease throughout my stay.

The hotel also has a wide selection of restaurants and shopping malls, so you could easily spend an entire day inside the hotel. If you're visiting Singapore, this is a one-of-a-kind hotel worth staying at at least once.

The gym is also outside the hotel and is relatively small. This is controversial. The hotel room is good. Satisfied.

review_text:
Room type: Family Suite
Price: A bit expensive, but the service and room reflect that.
Free car: Yes, you need to send an email to book it, but the hotel also takes the initiative to contact us via WhatsApp
Arrival at the hotel: There is someone to pick you up to check in and take you to your room, which makes you feel at home.
View: Excellent, overlooking the Gardens by the Bay
Room: Very good, except for the small bunk beds, other places are very big, and there is a big terrace.
Room facilities: There are washing machines and cooking supplies, very convenient
Hotel staff service: Very good. Every time I go out, I will see the cleaning staff asking if I need to clean the room or add supplies.
A special compliment: The hotel is very considerate and provides biscuits, pastes and juices for young children, which are also free.
Satisfaction level: Very satisfied

review_text:
It was a very nice hotel. It was the best of all the hotels I've stayed at so far.

In the room, there is a mixture of free things and things to purchase. You pay a deposit when you check in and pay when you check out. They ask you what you used.

For the free things, there is a message saying to use them, and there are no prices written. For things to purchase, you can find a price list nearby if you look. The alcohol in the photo is charged for. The wine on the table was a gift and was free.

It was a very nice hotel. It was the best of all the hotels I've stayed at so far.

review_text: The view is very good. I will stay in Jinsha next time.

review_text:
My luggage was damaged during early check-in...
They said they would deliver it to my room if I paid for it, but it didn't arrive when check-out time came, so I inquired and they said, "They understand that you're checking out tomorrow."...
No one knew what was going on, so I ended up being late for my next appointment.
I don't feel like they compensated me enough.
No one would want to stay at a hotel with a great view for a high price, but terrible hospitality...
By the way, the only apology they gave was for the delay in responding, and there was no apology at all for breaking my personal belongings in the first place.
Should I have just assumed that it was inevitable that things would get broken if I left them behind?

I would highly recommend this stay, as you will get service and time that exceeds the price.

review_text: Everything was great! From meeting at the taxi to leaving. We were upgraded to a higher floor!!! The room and view were gorgeous! We enjoyed the services and the hotel immensely!!! We will come again! Sincerely, guests from Siberia.
review_translated: Everything was great! From meeting at the taxi to leaving. We were upgraded to a higher floor!!! The room and view were gorgeous! We enjoyed the services and the hotel immensely!!! We will come again! Sincerely, guests from Siberia.

room_type: Sands Bay Suite King Gardens By The Bay View
review_text:
I booked a suite, and the facilities and location were great.
However, the service was disorganized and needed a lot of improvement.
Because it was a suite, club benefits were included, but I didn't receive a detailed explanation until I asked.
The fitness center was too far away, and I wasn't told about the available programs at check-in.
I booked an airport limousine, but I was told to pick up at Tower 1. It took a long time to confirm my reservation. I wasn't given specific instructions on where and what car to pick up, and was told to pick up at Tower 1. I had to ask around to find the agreed-upon time. The car was waiting at Tower 3, so I waited there and then boarded.
review_translated:
I booked a suite, and the facilities and location were great.
However, the service was disorganized and needed a lot of improvement.
Because it was a suite, club benefits were included, but I didn't receive a detailed explanation until I asked.
The fitness center was too far away, and I wasn't told about the available programs at check-in.
I booked an airport limousine, but I was told to pick up at Tower 1. It took a long time to confirm my reservation. I wasn't given specific instructions on where and what car to pick up, and was told to pick up at Tower 1. I had to ask around to find the agreed-upon time. The car was waiting at Tower 3, so I waited there and then boarded.

review_text:
I received the best service from the premium service team dedicated to the suite. A very friendly dedicated staff member personally took me to the room and explained in detail about the suite and how to use the hotel for about 20 minutes. 

The facilities and items were all the best, and the balcony was so big that I was surprised. However, because it was a large room, the floor was low. ㅠ
The comfort of the bed was the best I've ever used, and the bathroom products were all Jo Malone, and the hair dryer was Dyson. 

When I asked what we were celebrating, I said it was my son's birthday, and they provided high-end champagne, chocolate, and cake. They even sang a congratulatory song. 

Above all, the Marina Bay Sands infinity pool was the best, and the breakfast buffet was the best I've ever had, and all of these methods were convenient. 
The limousine that took us to the airport was a luxury limousine that only our family used, and a dedicated staff member came out at the departure time and helped us board, and the hotel staff who were at the airport in advance helped us check in. I heard that it is a hotel that you must stay at at least once in your life. It seems like it will be an unforgettable trip with shopping, food, facilities, and even the kindness of the staff. 

One thing that was disappointing was that the check-in process took too long.

review_text:
The Marina Bay Sands, where our family of three stayed, was spacious and clean enough. 
The view of Gardens by the Bay was amazing from the room. 
All the amenities were sufficient and all the facilities were perfect. The swimming pool on the top floor was also great. The dinner at the restaurant on the top floor was fantastic and the breakfast on the first floor was also very generous. It was easy to catch a taxi in the lobby and it was convenient to move to other tourist attractions in Singapore. 
And when we left the room for swimming, they cleaned it up. Our messy belongings were neatly organized and the amenities we used were added. 
I will stay here again next time.

review_text:
The room facilities and amenities were excellent.

The fitness center is free for guests to use and offers drinks and other services. We also enjoyed the pool on the 57th floor and the observation deck on the 56th floor (you have to enter from the side of the Tower 3 exit, but they gave priority to guests).

The coffee and tea we got from the free coffee machine in the room, and the chocolate we got were great.

room_type: Sands Premier Double Queen Gardens By The Bay View
review_text:
I mentioned some expectations in the order in advance for this trip. Ctrip is very dedicated. After seeing my needs, they took the initiative to contact the hotel, tried their best to meet my needs, and told me that they would try their best to arrange it. When we took a taxi to the hotel, a guy took the initiative to pick up the luggage and greeted us with a smile. We arrived early and the room was not vacant. The guy told us that the luggage would be put in the room when the room was vacated and gave us a card with the luggage number written on it. Use it when checking in, so that the luggage can be put directly into the room without making mistakes.
Entering the room, I was very surprised! It met my needs, the scenery was invincible, and the room was cleaned.
I would like to give special praise to the hotel. The room I booked this time has a 160 SGD bonus, which can be used in the mall of the Sands Hotel or for the buffet breakfast. I encountered a problem when registering for membership, and the bonus could not be received. The service desk guy kept trying various methods. They knew that I was leaving Singapore the next day and said that they would definitely find a way to deposit the bonus into my account on the same day. It was not received until 9:30 pm. I asked again, and the service desk had been replaced. But as soon as I told them about it, they knew about the handover and explained it clearly. They said that they had already entered the bonus through a special channel and the manual process, and assured me that the bonus was received at 10:30 pm. The next day, I used the bonus to enjoy the Sands's super buffet breakfast. The extra bonus bought bread and brought it home, so that my family could also taste the Sands's snacks together, and the whole trip came to a perfect end! 
I will book the Sands Hotel next time I go to Singapore! ! !

review_text: Honestly, I expected more. In fact, everything is not bad, but they gave me a room on the 3rd floor in tower 3, there was construction work going on somewhere and it was noisy during the day, this is not what you expect from 5 stars and such a price for a room. Plus queues both for check-in and for breakfast. But the advantages are of course the pool and the observation deck. The shopping center, casino, gardens are within walking distance. There is nothing special in the room, it is large and the TV is huge. In principle, that's all. I do not see the point in staying for such money for a long time, 1-2 days is normal. No more.

review_text: Only the reception doesn't match the hotel. Otherwise, it's one of the most appealing hotels in Singapore.
review_translated: Only the reception doesn't match the hotel. Otherwise, it's one of the most appealing hotels in Singapore.

review_text:
I waited in line for over 30 minutes to check in. The receptionist was Japanese and tried to talk to me, but the front desk staff spoke English, which I wish they'd offered an interpreter. It took another 20 minutes to get my key from the front desk. The hotel is so large that it took me an hour from the time I walked through the front door to the time I reached my room, which left me exhausted.
The hotel has just undergone a major renovation, so it's beautiful, but the view isn't great. The bed is so high I'm scared of falling off.
The TV screen is too big and too close.
The amenities are high-quality, including nail clippers and perfume. The tea provided is from a high-end tea shop in Singapore, which is impressive, but I was disappointed that I had to pay to use the luxurious-looking tea set.
The rooftop restaurant was extremely crowded and full of excited customers, which made it difficult to relax. The food court was also extremely crowded, with children squealing and yelling, which made it difficult to relax. I went to a pizza place, but it was just too expensive. It's probably paradise for those who want to shop for brand-name goods, but for those who aren't interested, it's just a huge dungeon. What's more, the guide didn't tell us the shortest route, and after taking the elevator to the upper floor, we were mysteriously taken back down the escalator.
The tiny 7-Eleven in front of the station was incredibly crowded, and the photo studio on the rooftop was a bit of a rip-off at 7,000 yen.
The staff ignored the drunk young people partying at 3am.
Checking out took just under 20 minutes round trip from our room to reception and then to catch a taxi from the third building.
It was a shame that we only had 13 hours to enjoy hotel life to the fullest.
If you stay at this hotel, I recommend leaving other sightseeing for another day and focusing on staying at the hotel.

room_type: Sands Premier Double Queen Gardens By The Bay View
review_text:
When I went on a trip with my mother, we could only stay one night due to budget constraints, but it became a very good memory!

We stayed on the 16th floor, and the view was great no matter what time of day we looked at it! All the hotel staff we passed were kind!

Also, although I didn't mention it when I booked the hotel, the woman who helped us at check-in, IVY, was happy to deliver a present to my mother later when she found out it was her birthday!

The night view from the pool on the 57th floor was also amazing!

I would definitely like to stay at this hotel again!

review_text:
I heard that they recently remodeled, so I could feel the interior was more luxurious than I thought. The shower used Bulgari amenities and had a neutral scent, which was perfect for my wife and I to use. 

The best view of Gardens by the Bay and the ocean right in front was from the 29th floor, and it was breathtaking and made my eyes feel refreshed. 

I also liked that they checked the interior for cleanliness and towels in the middle, but it was a little strange that there was not a single staff member who could translate into Korean in this large hotel. 

I recommend watching the evening show at Gardens by the Bay from your room or going there yourself.

review_text:
I stayed at Marina Bay Sands, and it was truly the finest hotel representing Singapore. First of all, the staff were very helpful from the time I checked in, and I was able to complete the procedures smoothly.

The room was spacious, and the view from the large window was spectacular. The city view was nice, but the view of the Gardens by the Bay side was particularly impressive. The facilities were also up to date, and the bathroom was luxurious and comfortable.

And the biggest attraction was the infinity pool on the rooftop. Spending time overlooking the night view of Singapore was truly a dream. Since it is a privilege only for guests staying at the hotel, it is recommended to visit early in the morning to avoid the crowds.

There is also a shopping mall and restaurants directly connected to the hotel, so you can enjoy yourself without going outside during your stay. There is also a *** and Sky Park observation deck, so you can enjoy yourself all day just inside the hotel.

The only drawback is that it is a popular hotel, so the check-in and elevator waiting times are a little long. However, even with that in mind, it is a hotel worth staying at. If you want to make your trip to Singapore special, I highly recommend it!
review_translated:

The room was spacious, and the view from the large window was spectacular. The city view was nice, but the view of the Gardens by the Bay side was particularly impressive. The facilities were also up to date, and the bathroom was luxurious and comfortable.

And the biggest attraction was the infinity pool on the rooftop. Spending time overlooking the night view of Singapore was truly a dream. Since it is a privilege only for guests staying at the hotel, it is recommended to visit early in the morning to avoid the crowds.

There is also a shopping mall and restaurants directly connected to the hotel, so you can enjoy yourself without going outside during your stay. There is also a *** and Sky Park observation deck, so you can enjoy yourself all day just inside the hotel.

The only drawback is that it is a popular hotel, so the check-in and elevator waiting times are a little long. However, even with that in mind, it is a hotel worth staying at. If you want to make your trip to Singapore special, I highly recommend it!

review_text:
This hotel is full of **, only fright, and no service! !

I booked a suite worth nearly 15,000 RMB (the ordinary room type was booked by Ctrip, and upgraded to a suite at the front desk), but I didn't expect that this was the beginning of a nightmare. . .

On the last night before returning to China, we were tired from playing during the day, so we washed up early and coaxed the baby to sleep. At about 22:30, a girlfriend who was traveling with me suddenly told me that her room was broken into by a stranger with a card. Fortunately, the door was locked with a chain, otherwise the consequences for a mother with a child would be unimaginable. Recalling several recent ** incidents in Southeast Asia, she decided to take her child (she didn't dare to leave the child alone in the room) to the front desk to negotiate in fear and anger. And I didn't dare to fall asleep in the room, staring at my phone to watch her synchronize the negotiations at the front desk.

She brought her child to the lobby to negotiate with the duty manager. What is infuriating is that the duty manager Clintson did not even offer a halfhearted consolation. The front desk even admitted that someone had indeed illegally broken into the room, but refused to let us retrieve the surveillance video, nor did they admit that there were any safety hazards in the hotel. They only replied that they would deal with it tomorrow (and asked her to go back to the room to sleep. Who would dare to take the child back to the room to sleep with a stranger breaking into the room at night?) After repeated communication failed, we could only call the police and hope for fair coordination by the police. Soon a young police officer came to the scene. After asking about the situation, he actually said that the police did not care about such incidents inside the hotel, and there was no need to check the surveillance. We just needed to change the room. It was almost two o'clock in the morning. We were exhausted physically and mentally, and the child was drowsy in the wheelchair. Speechless and helpless, the three mothers could only swallow their anger and take the children back to the room to rest in a foreign country, and they had no sleep all night. . .

The next day, the hotel replied that they could give us a room with breakfast and airport transfer. We asked, "If the hotel is not at fault and has no guilty conscience, why should it compensate us?" On the flight back to China, I wrote this paragraph, not for any compensation, but just hoping that the hotel can apologize sincerely. Singapore is now also a popular tourist destination for Chinese people, and the Sands Hotel is a popular online celebrity destination. However, if the basic personal safety of guests cannot be met, and there is no hospitality that dares to take responsibility and sincerely respects guests, what is there to brag about no matter how beautiful the scenery is? 
The store bullies customers, the process is rigid, the human nature is numb, and the attitude is cold. Can you stand such a Sands? Anyway, we will not stay there again. Writing down this frightening experience also reminds everyone not to be a big victim again.

review_text:
下午2:45 開始checkin 手續 整左45分鐘
正常3點有房 3:30俾得一間房
其他房重要答唔到 幾點拎到
最後5點幾先有房 重要俾漏左一間房
最痴線係開頭職員話
試下安排同一樓層結果
5間房3座tower5個樓層
啲行李一入酒店lobby
就强行幫人送上房
開頭話會 同一樓層或者同座
行李送曬第一間房 我哋要喺最遠嗰座 慢慢推翻啲行李
講到呢到已經太多不滿都未完
早上8點就開始裝修 嘈到完全訓唔到
每間房7000多元一晚 完全不值。
review_translated: 2:45 pm started checkin procedures made 45 minutes normally 3 o'clock room 3:30 give a room other rooms important can not answer what time to get to the last 5 o'clock to have a room important to miss a room most crazy is the beginning staff said try to arrange the same floor results 5 rooms 3 tower 5 floors of luggage We have to slowly overthrow some luggage in the farthest building to talk about this has been too much dissatisfaction is not over at 8 am to start the decoration noisy to sleep completely can not sleep more than 7000 per room a night is not worth it.

room_type: Sands Premier Double Queen Gardens By The Bay View
review_text: Most hotels in Singapore had really good room conditions and service, but Marina Bay Sands was by far the best! Cleanliness was basic and the room itself was very nice. Bathroom amenities were disposable Jo Malone products, the dryer was a Dyson product, and in addition, there was a bath bomb and a neck pillow that can be used while taking a half-body bath. The shower gown and slippers were so pretty that I loved them :) Not to mention the view. It was so cool without it! Personally, I was very satisfied with choosing the garden view because the city view was visible from the pool and didn't feel special. Breakfast and the food we ordered at the pool were so delicious! If you go to Singapore, I highly recommend staying at least one night.

review_text:
Luxurious hotel, everything was perfect except check-in. We arrived ahead of time (about 12) despite the fact that previously we were checked in within an hour, this time we patiently waited for 15:00. But even at 15:00 the room was not ready, so they sent us to wait for an email. After half an hour of waiting, the reception asked to wait another 40 minutes, since the room was still being cleaned. To my bewilderment, they offered me a room with a different view, although I specifically paid extra for a view of the bay. Then they offered us smoking rooms. After I refused everything, they gave me a voucher for $100. 
Returning 1 hour later, we again stood at the reception waiting for the card, having received it, we discovered that renovations were going on right above our room and we could not hear each other. After standing for 2 minutes, we went back to the reception. Then they changed our rooms again and gave us an improved room in another tower. 
Of course, the room was many times better than the one we booked. BUT! 
The time was 17:00. The hotel already provides only 20 hours of stay and took away 2 more. We spent the day walking in the hotel lobby instead of relaxing by the pool or the city. And I was absolutely not pleased with either the room upgrade or the $100 voucher 
The hotel is gorgeous, but the situation itself ruined the mood for the last day of vacation in Singapore.
review_translated:
Luxurious hotel, everything was perfect except check-in. We arrived ahead of time (about 12) despite the fact that previously we were checked in within an hour, this time we patiently waited for 15:00. But even at 15:00 the room was not ready, so they sent us to wait for an email. After half an hour of waiting, the reception asked to wait another 40 minutes, since the room was still being cleaned. To my bewilderment, they offered me a room with a different view, although I specifically paid extra for a view of the bay. Then they offered us smoking rooms. After I refused everything, they gave me a voucher for $100. 
Returning 1 hour later, we again stood at the reception waiting for the card, having received it, we discovered that renovations were going on right above our room and we could not hear each other. After standing for 2 minutes, we went back to the reception. Then they changed our rooms again and gave us an improved room in another tower. 
Of course, the room was many times better than the one we booked. BUT! 
The time was 17:00. The hotel already provides only 20 hours of stay and took away 2 more. We spent the day walking in the hotel lobby instead of relaxing by the pool or the city. And I was absolutely not pleased with either the room upgrade or the $100 voucher 
The hotel is gorgeous, but the situation itself ruined the mood for the last day of vacation in Singapore.

Even though I booked a package that included breakfast, breakfast was added when I checked out. When checking out, do not do automatic checkout, and check carefully.

The price was a little high, but I felt the service was well worth it!

review_text: The room is quite satisfactory. The most important thing about staying at the Sands is Singapore's national landmark building, with unobstructed views, the Strait of Malacca, and the infinity pool. The service attitude is still very good, with a Chinese reception 💁♀️! Worth a stay

review_text: This is my second time staying at this top luxury hotel with an invincible rooftop swimming pool! It feels more comfortable than the last time! From service to facilities to catering, the overall is good! I hope it will continue to be maintained and updated! I will come again if I have the chance in the future!
review_translated: This is my second time staying at this top luxury hotel with an invincible rooftop swimming pool! It feels more comfortable than the last time! From service to facilities to catering, the overall is good! I hope it will continue to be maintained and updated! I will come again if I have the chance in the future!

review_text:
The hygiene was impeccable, the room was very clean and tidy, and there were no hygienic blind spots. As a germaphobe, I didn't even use the sheets I brought with me. I also prepared two pairs of good quality disposable slippers, although I didn't use them. The bathroom supplies are also one of the most abundant I have ever seen in a hotel.

The environment is also perfect, with the bay cityscape on one side and the bay garden landscape on the other. The difference is not big, both are beautiful. The underground level is directly connected to the subway station, and there is also a luxury shopping mall that is the same size as the first floor of the hotel. Of course, the most worthwhile thing to visit is the sky garden and infinity swimming pool on the roof, which can account for at least 1/3 of the house price😂

The service is first-class. I stayed for one night and received a bunch of bottled water and snacks. But please note that some snacks and drinks require payment, and there is no clearly visible price list for you to see. This is probably because Paying guests won't care. There will be a queue for breakfast after 9 a.m., so be careful.

The facilities are complete, but the only drawback is that there is no resting place in the lobby. There is only a circle of marble floor for temporary resting, and there is no backrest. It is much worse than the humanized lobby of Shangri-La. It may be because it will be overcrowded.
Finally, let me talk about a fly in the ointment, that is, the hotel price is a bit high hahahaha, but there are still many people because it is very popular😃

review_text:
Third visit. Every time I come, the staff is always friendly. Room condition is good.
What's disappointing is that the pool water is a little dirty. Because there are so many users...
If you go to the swimming pool in the middle of the day and the sun is shining, it gets very hot and burns quickly. Recommended to use at night.
Recommend creating a reward card. Discounts available when using the spa.

room_type: Sands Premier Double Queen City View Room
review_text: Stayed twice, in a king-size room and a twin-bed room, but booked the latest renovated city view room, from which you can see the central business district, the bay, and the Merlion Park. The night view is also beautiful, and there are fountain shows. The newly renovated upgraded square room is large, and comes with chocolates and small candies, which are delicious. The service is particularly enthusiastic, and you can refill water at any time. Ask for a few more delicious chocolates. You must check in at the rooftop infinity pool, which is beautiful. The toiletries are from Jo Malone, and the razor is an antique design with a wooden handle, which is very special. Except that it is a bit expensive, there is basically nothing wrong with it. There are many set meals downstairs, which is extremely convenient and interesting to take parents and son out for a trip. It is very pleasant to lie on the bed and watch the scenery outside the window in the morning. Although it is a little expensive, I think I will come again next time

review_text: The hotel is an icon of Singapore, if possible, you should visit. We took the cheapest room, located on the lower floors. We were on the third floor, otherwise the room is ordinary. Good beds, the room had a free minibar, coffee machine. The robes are very small. The pool is beautiful, gorgeous views, open from early morning until late, unlimited towels, water, they carry guava juice. You can have a snack for reasonable money for Singapore. It's bad that there are no umbrellas from the sun. At the reception they met us halfway and did not take a deposit, because the card did not work. They also extended the room for 2 hours for free.

review_text:
Singapore's landmark hotel, you can enjoy VIP treatment after staying in, and you can go to the rooftop sky garden for free. The rooftop swimming pool is also free, and it is a must-visit place.
However, the room is close to the elevator, the elevator is noisy, and there is construction drilling upstairs, which is annoying.

review_text:
Check in at Marina Bay Sands Resort, Singapore
This should be one of the best hotels in Singapore. Tourists who come here to stay come from all over the world, and the entire lobby is full of tourists waiting to check in.
The hotel front desk is very good, and upgraded me to a sea view room for free, and gave me a birthday cake for free🎂The sea view room is really beautiful, the scenery is great, the room is large, all the free utensils are very high-end, the chocolate cake is great, and the taste is very good.
In general, this is the most expensive and high-end hotel I have ever stayed in. The scenery, service and facilities are worthy of its price. You must stay at Marina Bay Sands Hotel once when you come to Singapore.

In general, this is the most expensive and high-end hotel I have ever stayed in. The scenery, service and facilities are worthy of its price. You must stay at Marina Bay Sands Hotel once when you come to Singapore.

review_text: I waited for 2 hours to do a business but nothing was done. They said I could get a room upgrade, but it wasn't. I couldn't delay check-out. Such an expensive hotel doesn't answer anything I asked. The business skills are also poor. The service is really bad. Try not to stay there. It's not worth getting angry. Everything except the water costs money. The experience is not good at all

review_text: The pool view car is really nice. The room is spacious and I want to go again.

review_text: It is simply a top hotel, an experience you won't forget so quickly
review_translated: It is simply a top hotel, an experience you won't forget so quickly

review_text:
It was the worst.

This is not a hotel where you can stay for 100,000 yen without meals.

When I checked in, I was informed that there may be noise due to construction work, but

It was so noisy that it sounded like the room next door was drilling holes until about 5pm at night and from 9am. This is not a room that you can charge money for. If the noise is so bad, you should be shown to another tower. This is unthinkable in Japan. It should be a full refund.

Instead of "There may be noise," they should advertise it as "This is a room where the noise is so loud you can cover your ears."

If anything, they should post such an explanation on the reservation site when making a reservation!!

For such a large hotel, there were no Japanese staff and the service was worse than that of a business hotel. I was looking forward to breakfast, but it was so bad that I didn't want to waste money, so I checked out immediately.

What's the point of construction starting earlier than check-out? I wondered.

Please try paying 100,000 yen yourself to stay at the hotel, including the manager and staff.

review_text: If you are transiting through Singapore when going to Maldives, this is a natural choice.
review_translated: If you are transiting through Singapore when going to Maldives, this is a natural choice.

review_text: I was satisfied with every part! I recommend it for its cleanliness and Gardens by the Bay view. The staff are all friendly and there are even Korean staff, so there is no problem communicating!
review_translated: I was satisfied with every part! I recommend it for its cleanliness and Gardens by the Bay view. The staff are all friendly and there are even Korean staff, so there is no problem communicating!

review_text: The view from the balcony of the Marina Bay view room at Sands Tower 3 is unparalleled. The overall decoration style of the room seems a bit old. After taking a shower, the mirror is fogged up and nothing can be seen. There are very small insects crawling around on the table. Went there. If it wasn’t for taking photos and checking in at the infinity pool, I would not choose to stay in this hotel in the future. In addition, the Rise buffet on the first floor is good and very cost-effective. It has seafood sashimi, Nyonya-style snacks, self-service drink stations, and bird stomachs. It can’t fit in at all!

The outdoor swimming pool on the rooftop is definitely worth a visit, but the facilities are indeed lacking in design, and the hair dryer cannot be plugged in the bathroom. In addition, the front desk guy's explanation is very detailed, thumbs up!

review_text: The hotel is very good in all aspects. There is Chinese service. When communication is inconvenient, the waiter who speaks Chinese will reply. The room planning and design are reasonable, the decoration is also very elegant, the balcony is very large, and the most attractive thing is the infinity pool on the roof, but too many people check in and take pictures. When I was swimming, I found that the pool water was very dirty and turbid. I didn't dare to swim for a while. I caught a cold after returning home. I don't know if it has anything to do with this. The hotel still needs to strengthen the cleaning and disinfection of the pool water. But it is still worth staying again.

review_text: This time I stayed in Building 3 which has not been renovated. The soundproofing is OK. The room is not big, there is no bathtub, and the shower room has no door so the water will spill outside. I don't know if the room has been improved after the renovation. It is convenient to go to the roof. We arrived at 10 pm on April 30th, and went to the infinity pool at 10 am the next day. It may be very sunny at this time so there are not many people. The most valuable place of this hotel is this infinity pool. The scenery and experience are indeed special.

review_text: I visited MBS, which I wanted to go to for my honeymoon. The location, night view, and swimming pool were all great! Thanks to this, I had a great honeymoon and made good memories. It was the best hotel in my life, so much so that I want to bring my parents next time!
review_translated: I visited MBS, which I wanted to go to for my honeymoon. The location, night view, and swimming pool were all great! Thanks to this, I had a great honeymoon and made good memories. It was the best hotel in my life, so much so that I want to bring my parents next time!

review_text:
I really enjoyed the early check-in. The swimming pool is perfect for flexing and the observatory is also great. With these two alone, I feel like I'm getting my money's worth when it comes to accommodations. Instead of going too hard, just use these two and see the Super Tree Show and the Fountain Show. The Supertree show is a bit uninspiring to watch at the hotel because the sound is hard to hear... If you watch it at the hotel, I think it will be more impressive if you at least turn on the sound while broadcasting the screen on the TV Sands channel.
Merlion Park is a bit difficult to walk to in the middle of the day. It would be better to go in the morning when the sun is less bright. Flower Dome is not recommended. The garden is still there... Don't waste your energy, it's better to stay at the accommodation and go to the observatory or the swimming pool one more time. The night pool is also nice. I was exhausted from going there, so I couldn't go to the swimming pool at night. ㅠㅠ
I think the quality of the souvenirs at the souvenir shop in the middle of Towers 2 and 3 is good. It's a small thing, but for some products, if you have a Sands membership, you can get a 10% discount, and if you spend more than $100, you can get a tax refund at the airport.
Well then, have a nice trip~
review_translated:
I really enjoyed the early check-in. The swimming pool is perfect for flexing and the observatory is also great. With these two alone, I feel like I'm getting my money's worth when it comes to accommodations. Instead of going too hard, just use these two and see the Super Tree Show and the Fountain Show. The Supertree show is a bit uninspiring to watch at the hotel because the sound is hard to hear... If you watch it at the hotel, I think it will be more impressive if you at least turn on the sound while broadcasting the screen on the TV Sands channel.
Merlion Park is a bit difficult to walk to in the middle of the day. It would be better to go in the morning when the sun is less bright. Flower Dome is not recommended. The garden is still there... Don't waste your energy, it's better to stay at the accommodation and go to the observatory or the swimming pool one more time. The night pool is also nice. I was exhausted from going there, so I couldn't go to the swimming pool at night. ㅠㅠ
I think the quality of the souvenirs at the souvenir shop in the middle of Towers 2 and 3 is good. It's a small thing, but for some products, if you have a Sands membership, you can get a 10% discount, and if you spend more than $100, you can get a tax refund at the airport.
Well then, have a nice trip~

review_text: Cool hotel! The pool is beyond praise. View from the pool of the beauty and sights of Singapore. The room was located on the 44th floor, the view was wonderful, there were gifts from the hotel.
review_translated: Cool hotel! The pool is beyond praise. View from the pool of the beauty and sights of Singapore. The room was located on the 44th floor, the view was wonderful, there were gifts from the hotel.

review_text: It is indeed possible. The service, hygiene and dishes are all OK.
review_translated: It is indeed possible. The service, hygiene and dishes are all OK.

review_text: The hotel's facilities are perfect, the scenery is first-class, the transportation is convenient, there are shopping malls and ** downstairs, and it has everything you need for food, clothing, housing, transportation, and entertainment. The room is relatively old and the price-performance ratio is not high, but the overall experience is still very good.

review_text: Beautiful environment, strategic location, shopping and shopping are super convenient!

review_text: Friendly service, the housekeeping department is very good, the check-out speed is convenient and there is no need to wait too much. Next time I have a long vacation, I will give priority to this place to visit again. At the same time, I will invite more friends to go together, leaving a good memory in my life.

review_translated: It was the best hotel, with the best view, with the best staff. An unforgettable experience😃 I recommend it 100%

review_text: The room facing the street was very noisy, and there was decoration noise at 1:30 in the middle of the night. The doorman service is good. The lobby looks like a big car shop. We lived in Building 3, and the room spare parts were very poor. The Sands Hotel is overpriced and has a false reputation.

We lived in Building 3, and the room spare parts were very poor. The Sands Hotel is overpriced and has a false reputation.

review_text:
Facilities: very good
Hygiene: very good
good environment
Service: The staff is actually very hardworking. It's just that the hotel is too big, with too many rooms and too many tourists. It feels like both the front desk reception and room service are too busy.

Facilities: very good
Hygiene: very good
good environment
Service: The staff is actually very hardworking. It's just that the hotel is too big, with too many rooms and too many tourists. It feels like both the front desk reception and room service are too busy.

review_text: The location is first-class and the transportation is convenient. There are many taxis at the door and there is MRT nearby. It takes 20 minutes to get to Singapore.
review_translated: The location is first-class and the transportation is convenient. There are many taxis at the door and there is MRT nearby. It takes 20 minutes to get to Singapore.

review_text: This time traveling from Chongqing to Singapore, we chose a harbor view room on the 40th floor of Tower 3 of Marina Bay Sands Resort in Singapore. The room is close to the north side of the floor. On the left side of the entrance is a floor-to-ceiling glass window, overlooking the spiral road and the amusement park. When you open the room, you will first notice that it is very bright, clean and hygienic, with daily necessities neatly arranged, and the brand and quality department are very good; secondly, it pays great attention to details. There are warm reminders on the TV screen in the room. The curtains are open, the sunshades are closed, and the temperature of the air conditioner is also adjusted very moderately, making it feel very warm. The third is to open the sunshades on the balcony to see the amusement park, coastal park, and cruise terminal. The entire harbor scenery is unobstructed! ...Everything about my stay this time was good, except that the flowers on the balcony of other people's rooms were blooming brightly. It was a pity that the bougainvillea in our room had no flowers! I took some photos after checking in just to prove my visit, haha😃

review_text: Because we were on honeymoon, our room was upgraded and we were given a small cake, a fan outside the window, and a swimming pool. Needless to say, thank you very much for letting us leave beautiful memories ❤️

I stayed here to celebrate my birthday.

I was given a wonderful room and was able to spend a meaningful time.
I still wanted to enjoy Marina Bay Sands, so I'll definitely stay here again.

You can enjoy the light show of Gardens by the Bay from the balcony, which is a great view. In short, it is not worth it purely based on the room price-performance ratio, but considering the hotel location, scenery, infinity pool, sky garden and other additional values, it is still worth experiencing.

review_text: Everything was good except that the cost-effectiveness was a bit low, but check-in was at 3 o'clock and it took over an hour. Even after checking in, there was no room, so I waited for about an hour more.

review_text: The room facilities are smart and hygienic. You can swim in the endless water on the 57th floor, check in and take photos. You can also watch the city night view and the Marina Bay Gardens light show at night. There are many breakfast options.

review_text: I came to Singapore 10 years ago, but I didn't think I would stay at the Marina Bay Sands. I just went to the top of the Marina Bay Sands as a tourist to see the surrounding scenery. 10 years later, I suddenly realized that I must stay at the Marina Bay Sands this time! I stayed there for two nights and it was a great experience!

I just went to the top of the Marina Bay Sands as a tourist to see the surrounding scenery. 10 years later, I suddenly realized that I must stay at the Marina Bay Sands this time! I stayed there for two nights and it was a great experience!

review_text: The hotel is excellent in terms of service, facilities, food, etc., excellent views, including air gardens, infinity pool unlimited access, very convenient transportation, excellent nearby facilities, a large shopping mall and **, the only drawback is expensive
review_translated: The hotel is excellent in terms of service, facilities, food, etc., excellent views, including air gardens, infinity pool unlimited access, very convenient transportation, excellent nearby facilities, a large shopping mall and **, the only drawback is expensive

review_text:
When my husband and I checked in, we were assisted by Justin at the front desk, who was very kind and polite.
Bellboy Joel also handled our luggage well.
The room we stayed in was also beautiful and the view was amazing.
We will definitely stay at the Marina Bay Sands Hotel again when we travel to Singapore.

The room we stayed in was also beautiful and the view was amazing.
We will definitely stay at the Marina Bay Sands Hotel again when we travel to Singapore.

review_text: Book three consecutive nights and get a free upgrade to a garden view room😃The transportation hub Bayfront is very convenient to various attractions; Sands** and the infinity pool are directly accessible by internal elevators😀; The Lion Rock Park is opposite the hotel, and the Ferris wheel🎡 is a few hundred meters away on foot; it's a great experience to have a short gathering with childhood friends.
review_translated: Book three consecutive nights and get a free upgrade to a garden view room😃The transportation hub Bayfront is very convenient to various attractions; Sands** and the infinity pool are directly accessible by internal elevators😀; The Lion Rock Park is opposite the hotel, and the Ferris wheel🎡 is a few hundred meters away on foot; it's a great experience to have a short gathering with childhood friends.

review_text: As a landmark building in Singapore, the hotel is amazing. Regardless of the location, service, environment, sanitation, catering and entertainment are all in place. Guests come from all over the world. As hotel guests, you can also enjoy unlimited access to the infinity pool on the 57th floor and the sky garden on the 56th floor, right out of the balcony. The view is directly connected to the Gardens by the Bay and the subway station. There are countless advantages. As for the facilities in the hotel room, they are quite satisfactory. However, various drinks in the refrigerator are provided every day. Overall, it is very good. I will stay here next time I come to Singapore.

We specially staggered the trip during the peak period. Unexpectedly, there are still many people. It is quite convenient for shopping. The buffet in the lobby There seems to be a discount for using the room card.

review_text: The room is large, has a nice view, and is very clean and tidy! The service is also very considerate! Very satisfied! It is also a must-choice hotel for a family trip! Must visit again next time!
review_translated: The room is large, has a nice view, and is very clean and tidy! The service is also very considerate! Very satisfied! It is also a must-choice hotel for a family trip! Must visit again next time!

review_text:
Top hotel with exceptional service! Upon check-in, we were surprised with an upgrade to a new, renovated room with a bathtub!
Inside the room there was a Nespresso and welcome treats! And the whole hotel smells great! Access to the infinity pool and the Sky deck is a plus that is well worth it and having breakfast watching the sun rise in the restaurant on the 57th floor was incredible! It was truly an incredible experience for our whole family!
review_translated:
Top hotel with exceptional service! Upon check-in, we were surprised with an upgrade to a new, renovated room with a bathtub!

Access to the infinity pool and the Sky deck is a plus that is well worth it and having breakfast watching the sun rise in the restaurant on the 57th floor was incredible! It was truly an incredible experience for our whole family!

review_text: After all, it is the Sands Hotel. Although it is a bit old, the hardware is still well maintained. Because it is under renovation, it does not affect the experience of staying, but the price is really cost-effective compared with the facilities and equipment. Fortunately, I came here to live for the infinity pool, and I ignored other things. But this home does not have a bathtub, which is a bit regrettable. Overall, it is OK, no highlights, no faults, and the feeling is mediocre.
review_translated: After all, it is the Sands Hotel. Although it is a bit old, the hardware is still well maintained. review_text: I booked a deluxe room (Gardens by the Bay view). It was originally 35 square meters, but I was upgraded to a deluxe suite (Gardens by the Bay) for free. When I entered the room and saw the sea view, I was shocked. My daughter jumped up with excitement and said we paid 5,000. It feels like living more than 10,000 yuan. The staff did not speak Chinese when we checked in, but they were equipped with a dedicated Chinese translator. The service was very warm and thoughtful. After checking in, we were sent to the elevator. There was a person in charge of luggage at the entrance of the hotel lobby. There were staff on arrival or departure. Help with luggage. I saw a red hotel outside the hotel at night. I felt very beautiful and shocked. The hotel is connected to the shopping mall and it is worth visiting. It is very beautiful. I also went to the infinity pool on the 57th floor and the sky garden on the 56th floor. , you can see the scenery of the entire city. What I feel is insufficient is that the hotel's elevators have set up prescribed floors. You have to go to Tower 3 to go up to the 57th floor. It seems that you have to go to Tower 3 to go up to the 56th floor. It's hard to find the new ones. The hotel is very big and running is quite hard. The only drawback is that check-out at 11 o'clock is a bit early. The sky garden opens at 11 o'clock and you have to check out before 11 o'clock. I applied to the front desk for a delayed check-out until 11:45 because I wanted to play in the sky. Garden, with permission. All in all, I was very satisfied with my stay.

review_text: For a room that costs close to 7,000 a night, the eyelashes were not cleaned... The only purpose of staying at Sands is to use the infinity swimming pool on the 57th floor. It is not recommended to choose other food and drinks in the hotel, which made me laugh.
review_translated: For a room that costs close to 7,000 a night, the eyelashes were not cleaned... The only purpose of staying at Sands is to use the infinity swimming pool on the 57th floor. It is not recommended to choose other food and drinks in the hotel, which made me laugh.

review_text: The location is very good and the scenery is good, but it is relatively dilapidated. The hotel has a certain age, but the hotel service is good. If you can arrange to stay on the same floor, it will be OK.
review_translated: The location is very good and the scenery is good, but it is relatively dilapidated. The hotel has a certain age, but the hotel service is good. If you can arrange to stay on the same floor, it will be OK.

review_text: Prices are more expensive during the Spring Festival, but the overall feeling is pretty good. Just looking at the room facilities is certainly not cost-effective, but most people who come to Sands probably come for the infinity pool. It’s worth checking in. If you stay for a day or two, you can change to other cost-effective hotels.

review_text: I stayed for three days and had a lot of fun. I also watched the night view. I also watched the drone show in the room. The overall feeling was good. The room was also clean and tidy.
review_translated: I stayed for three days and had a lot of fun. I also watched the night view. I also watched the drone show in the room. The overall feeling was good. The room was also clean and tidy.

review_text:
Environment: The location of the core Marina Bay is very good. It is equipped with top-notch commercial facilities. It is very convenient for dining, entertainment and shopping.
Room: The quilts, pillows and mattresses are all of six-star quality. Outside the balcony is the Coastal Botanical Garden. You can also see the sunrise and the South Pacific. The view is wide. The layout of the bathroom has been rated as my favorite by my mother.
Breakfast: rich variety, fresh ingredients, attentive service, convenient seating and layout, not messy.
Swimming pool: Absolutely the best in the world, bar none.
Special note: When checking in, Marie, the beauty at the front desk, found out that my mommy’s birthday was 5 days ago, and specially arranged a birthday gift. She was super happy. At the same time, the warm and thoughtful service made our visit to Singapore for the Spring Festival even more happy💗
All in all: the best hotel in Singapore 👍

All in all: the best hotel in Singapore 👍

review_text:
The most satisfying thing about the 5 days in Singapore was the Sands Hotel. I stayed at the Sands Hotel for 2 nights and it was not enough. I could eat, drink, play and buy everything. There is a subway and taking a taxi is also convenient.

Downstairs is the Gardens by the Bay, and you can watch the light show on the balcony at night. The infinity pool on the 57th floor is amazing. You can see the city view during the day and the night view at night. Order a cocktail and get drunk, hahahaha.

The service is also great and all needs are met quickly. Breakfast is also very good, rich in variety, including Chinese and Western food.

I will stay here next time I go to Singapore!
review_translated:
The most satisfying thing about the 5 days in Singapore was the Sands Hotel. I stayed at the Sands Hotel for 2 nights and it was not enough. I could eat, drink, play and buy everything. There is a subway and taking a taxi is also convenient.

Downstairs is the Gardens by the Bay, and you can watch the light show on the balcony at night. The infinity pool on the 57th floor is amazing. You can see the city view during the day and the night view at night. Order a cocktail and get drunk, hahahaha.

The service is also great and all needs are met quickly. Breakfast is also very good, rich in variety, including Chinese and Western food.

I will stay here next time I go to Singapore!

review_text: A very good experience, especially the skyline swimming pool is worth the price. The front desk even upgraded the room for us😁

review_text: It is worth staying in this hotel because of the swimming pool. The front desk service is very attentive. There are many restaurants in the shopping mall next to it, which is convenient for travel and shopping. The hotel facilities are very new and the rooms are large.
review_translated: It is worth staying in this hotel because of the swimming pool. The front desk service is very attentive. There are many restaurants in the shopping mall next to it, which is convenient for travel and shopping. The hotel facilities are very new and the rooms are large.

review_text: I don’t know why the Sands Hotel is so popular. Check-in really has to wait until three in the afternoon. I couldn’t wait and asked the front desk to check it for me. Finally, I checked in early. The room was quite big and the price was right. It’s not cheap. I feel that the soundproofing of the house is not good because it’s on the roadside and it’s very noisy. I probably won’t stay there in the future. I don’t think it’s worth it. If you want to go to the rooftop swimming pool, you can buy a ticket to go in. There’s no need to spend that much. More money for one night. The man at the front desk who speaks Chinese is very patient.

personal experience

3. Transportation is not far from surrounding attractions, such as supertree
4. Scenery. You must go to the swimming pool. You must definitely go! 😁😁😁

review_text: The receptionist at the Tower3 front desk named Pei Ying has poor English and is not familiar with business and has no sense of service. Because I changed the room type and needed to get a new room card in Tower 3, the staff member was completely confused and asked me to go back to Tower 1. Fortunately, I knew how to insist on getting it from her. I told her my name once but she didn't understand. She added spell twice but still didn't understand. Then she wanted to send me to Tower 1 again. I pulled out my passport and, okay, she understood. Can we arrange new decoration? Can't. I don’t know if it’s because I booked it on Ctrip. Can I arrange for a high floor? It’s not possible because your house has already been determined. In short, nothing is possible. The happy vacation mood was ruined by her. Jinsha looks good and is famous, but the service hardware is not up to par. I will not stay here again.
review_translated: The receptionist at the Tower3 front desk named Pei Ying has poor English and is not familiar with business and has no sense of service. Because I changed the room type and needed to get a new room card in Tower 3, the staff member was completely confused and asked me to go back to Tower 1. Fortunately, I knew how to insist on getting it from her. I told her my name once but she didn't understand. She added spell twice but still didn't understand. review_text: The night view from the room and the pool is amazing. It's a shame that we didn't get to our room even after 2.5 hours of checking in. We kept getting told "it's not ready yet" when we asked. It's the first time we've had to wait so long on any trip.
review_translated: The night view from the room and the pool is amazing. It's a shame that we didn't get to our room even after 2.5 hours of checking in. We kept getting told "it's not ready yet" when we asked. It's the first time we've had to wait so long on any trip.

review_text: Singapore city landmark hotel, service cannot match the price. Other five-star hotels will provide nightly room cleaning in the afternoon without the need for customers to ring the bell or call the phone. This is not the case and will not come even after ringing the bell. After the meal in the room is finished, ring the bell to pick up the used tableware. Either they don't come or they come to pick it up at 12 o'clock in the middle of the night.

This is not the case and will not come even after ringing the bell. After the meal in the room is finished, ring the bell to pick up the used tableware. Either they don't come or they come to pick it up at 12 o'clock in the middle of the night.

review_text: This is the best hotel. The staff were really friendly and treated me well even though they didn't speak English. The facilities have been remodeled and are very clean.

review_text: The infinity swimming pool and sightseeing platform have unobstructed views, and are directly connected to Marina Bay Gardens and Sands Mall. room_type: Sands Premier Double Queen Gardens By The Bay View
review_text: The ultimate wonderful experience, the service is very good 👍 Especially thanks to James for upgrading me to a suite. It was a very enjoyable trip. I will choose Sands Hotel next time I come to Singapore!

room_type: Sands Premier Suite King City View
review_text: It was my first time to go to Singapore and Maldives. I had to experience the Sands during my honeymoon. I booked a newly renovated city view suite for two nights, which was great. It also had a partial view of the Marina Bay Gardens. The infinity pool was great, especially at night. It was worth checking in, but there were too many people. I could only check in and check in for the breakfast buffet. There is also an option downstairs next to the swimming pool. I ate there for two days and the downstairs was very rich. I communicated through many emails in advance and told me that I was coming to the hotel for my honeymoon. The hotel sent red wine and cakes and also gave me a pick-up and drop-off experience at the airport in Elfa. It's great. Thank you to the hotel for the arrangement. Sands is really beautiful. Singapore feels very good.

I could only check in and check in for the breakfast buffet. There is also an option downstairs next to the swimming pool. I ate there for two days and the downstairs was very rich.
