review_text: The sea view room has a good view and a large balcony, but the facilities are relatively outdated. The infinity pool on the top floor is just like that, not satisfactory. The shopping mall below is very large, with a full range of luxury brands, and the prices are almost the same as those in China.
review_translated: The sea view room has a good view and a large balcony, but the facilities are relatively outdated. The infinity pool on the top floor is just like that, not satisfactory. The shopping mall below is very large, with a full range of luxury brands, and the prices are almost the same as those in China.

review_text: Some people say that Marina Bay Sands is like a flea market, but I loved it so much. If you come to Singapore, I definitely recommend staying at the landmark Marina Bay Sands for one night! I arrived at around 5:30 in the morning and needed early check-in, but they said early check-in was not possible, so I paid an additional fee and checked in early. They also upgraded the room by one level. I paid the additional fee, but I have no regrets at all, and the room size and condition were both excellent. However, the refrigerator was not cold. The best benefit was being able to use the Marina Bay Sands swimming pool, and swimming while looking at the night view was like heaven. I highly recommend it!

The best benefit was being able to use the Marina Bay Sands swimming pool, and swimming while looking at the night view was like heaven. I highly recommend it!

room_type: Sands Premier Double Queen City View Room
review_text:
Top-class. 1.5 times higher level than Signiel in Seoul.
Must visit when you are newlyweds or on a business trip.
Must have a deposit (prepare cash in advance).
If you are sensitive to card cancellation transactions, withdraw at least $400.
The water is clean and the tea and coffee are good.
If you have visited here, you have almost seen all of Singapore. Don't worry, it is the top.
There is also a Korean guidebook.

Best for traveling.

review_text: A stranger entered by swiping his card in the middle of the night, and the hotel delayed the handling. The police intervened and negotiated and investigated to no avail. At two o'clock in the morning, he was transferred to a room full of cigar smell. I couldn't sleep at all. In view of the frequent tragedies abroad, it's scary to think about it. The overall feeling is very bad. It was not handled properly. Anyone who can be persuaded to leave is one.

review_text: The room is beautiful, free upgrade, shopping is very convenient, you have to queue for breakfast😅The service is okay except for the last day when we had to take a taxi to the airport, the foreign staff used the intercom to call a foreign driver, we were very grateful and gave a tip, but the driver Rip off haha, my friend paid 17 SGD when he pressed it and it turned into 48 SGD. I called the hotel to complain and told them that this happened. There is no further information for the time being. I just said that I will take it seriously and remind everyone to use it. Grab your own taxi, don’t trust hotel staff

The staff were all friendly and the service was excellent, and the rooms were of a very good standard. I will definitely use it next time I visit Singapore.

review_text: Very satisfied, the Christmas atmosphere in the hotel is particularly good. It is especially suitable for hotels with children. The infinity pool has a good view. I will stay at this hotel next time I go to Singapore and book a newly renovated room next time.

review_text: The room was very comfortable and the view from the balcony was great. The front desk was very welcoming. Seeing that we had two children and couldn't get an extra bed, they upgraded the room type for free. We had to queue for a long time for breakfast but it was worth it.

room_type: Sands Premier King Gardens By The Bay View
review_text:
It took nearly an hour to check in, and then we were told that we could get coupons for free. As a result, they were completely unfamiliar with the internal process, so we had to go back and forth again.
When we got to the room, we couldn't open the lock. We waited for ten minutes before someone came to handle it. When we got to the room, we told the front desk to make sure that the door lock could be opened smoothly when we returned to the hotel. Unfortunately, the door lock still opened when we came back. not open. Very poor stay experience
review_translated:
It took nearly an hour to check in, and then we were told that we could get coupons for free. As a result, they were completely unfamiliar with the internal process, so we had to go back and forth again.

review_text:
The service facilities are good, but the price/performance ratio is low and the satisfaction is average.

There was a long line to check in. I arrived at Tower 1 at 3:40 pm. When I got off the bus, there was a waiter who would store your luggage and help you get to your room. When I was waiting in line, I was told that the deluxe room had to go to Tower 3. But I was already halfway in line and was too lazy to move because I had to start again when I got to Tower 3. The front desk/customer service is all in English. I checked in on my birthday and received blessings. The same room was upgraded to a bigger one, but the scenery is not attractive. I feel that the scenery in the garden is better.

Checked into tower 2 20/f. After checking in, I called customer service to ask for recommended Chinese restaurants. It was enthusiastically recommended but most of them were full. I had to be seated first after 8 o'clock. The third restaurant recommended was finally available but had to be handed over within a time limit. I made a reservation successfully and the taste was pretty good.

The facility has a smart toilet. The TV has chromecast but it will cut off every once in a while. Toiletries are available. The vanity mirror has lights and can be magnified. I complain that the water in the shower room will flow out of the door and make the floor slippery￼
￼
Environment: The rooftop swimming pool has beautiful scenery

Breakfast: Went to 56/f spago for the buffet at our own expense. Then I felt that I didn’t get any delicious food🥲 Fortunately, I went early at 9 o’clock and there was not much queue. There was already a long queue after finishing the meal.

review_text: The location of Jinsha Hotel is very good, the hotel service is also very good, shopping is very convenient, and there are many kinds of food. The hotel's breakfast is also very rich. However, the facilities in the room are similar to those in domestic fast hotels. The shower room has no door and only a fixed shower head. The noise in the room was so loud that it was like sleeping on the side of the road at night. For a room costing more than 5,000 yuan a night, this was a very bad experience!

We were traveling with the elderly, and the two elders could only stand next to us waiting for us.

review_text: As the last hotel we stayed in Singapore, we came here for its swimming pool. When I checked in, I casually asked if I could upgrade the room. The lady was very nice and said she would help me find one. In fact, I just wanted a renovated room. In the end, the lady upgraded us to a suite. It was a little surprise. Maybe it was because I brought my baby? Anyway, the whole stay experience was great. The swimming pool was great, and free fruit and juice were provided. During the stay, we found that one of the toiletries boxes was empty. The customer service department immediately sent two boxes up, and also sent the children's toiletries and some small gifts for children. In short, it was very considerate. There are food, drinks and shopping downstairs in the hotel, which is very convenient. There are cheap and expensive ones; the shopping mall is a bit large, and it is connected to the subway station and ** below. The sky garden upstairs is open to guests for free, and it is also a tourist attraction at ordinary times.

review_text: The Sands Hotel not only has first-class facilities and views, but also has first-class services. You can only get a room at the hotel at three o'clock, but due to our schedule, we arrived at a little after one o'clock. We originally thought of checking in first and then walking around, but the front desk saw We had a child with us and he actively helped us see if there was a room where we could clean it up first. We found that there was a twin room, but because the child was small, we had to get a double bed room. We also expressed our willingness to wait. At this time, the child Already asleep. The front desk kept smiling and asked us to wait patiently. They tried to help us upgrade the room. Not only was the high floor also newly renovated, it was a surprise. Although it took almost 20 minutes to check in from ordering questions to confirming the room, the result was very satisfying for us. very satisfied.

After checking in, you can visit the sky garden and infinity pool.
The infinity swimming pool on the top floor is unparalleled. If you feel the water temperature is cold at night, you can take a dip in the warm pool area.
The room is warm and comfortable. It's a pity that we didn't stay in a newly decorated room this time.
It happened to be my family's birthday that month, and the hotel thoughtfully sent me a small cake.
The service and various facilities are very good, and the staff are very friendly.
The whole family was very happy to stay here.

review_text: 帶孩子專門選了新裝修房間過來住了一晚，辦入住整個過程快1個小時你敢信，一堆人在大廳排隊罰站來着。沒有任何主動的服務，全靠自己提，有需要打電話叫也會送，有會中文的服務人員，大部分衹會説英文，或者衹願説英文。這個房價説實話不值，如果覺得來都來了，想要打卡住一下可以，衹是住新裝修的房間好一些，舊的客房就連打車過來司機都在吐槽。總之個人覺得不適合親子，沒有任何為孩子多餘準備的相應服務。
review_translated: I took my kids to a newly renovated room for a one-night stay. The entire check-in process took almost an hour, and there were tons of people standing in line in the lobby. There was no proactive service at all; you had to ask for things yourself. If you called, they would bring you to the room. While some staff spoke Chinese, most spoke only English, or were willing to speak only English. Honestly, the price wasn't worth it. If you're already here and want to check in, it's fine. The newly renovated rooms are better, but even the taxi drivers complained about the old rooms. Overall, I don't think it's a family-friendly hotel. There aren't any extra services for children.

review_text: The newly renovated room is very nice. I had to wait for half an hour to check in. The arrangement was also very poor and I didn't reserve the room first.

review_text: When I arrived at the airport on the day of departure, I found that my passport was left in the room, so I immediately called the hotel for help to check and confirm. If the hotel could confirm it as soon as possible, I could ask a friend who lives nearby to go to the hotel to help pick up my passport and send it to the airport, so that I could catch the flight. I called many times to ask for their help, but to no avail. Every time I received the call back they said they would call me back as soon as they found the person, but I never received a reply. I waited for more than 2 hours but still couldn't get a confirmation, and ended up missing my flight. Finally I went to the hotel, and they told me that they had found it and left it at the front desk. It took so long to figure out something that could have been resolved in a short time, and they didn't call me back after they found it as they said on the phone before.

review_text:
We stayed on the 32nd floor of Tower 3 Level. The hotel has a very beautiful scenery, full of sunshine and fresh style.

我们住在Tower 3 Level的32层。酒店风景非常美丽，阳光充足，风格清新。
review_translated: We stayed on the 32nd floor of Tower 3 Level. The hotel has a very beautiful scenery, full of sunshine and fresh style.

review_text:
1. The check-in experience is very poor. There are few Chinese check-in services at the front desk. If you don’t understand English, you just have to speak. There are also those who can understand Chinese and can only answer questions in English. Tower 1 has better service than Tower 3.
2.P1 is the air conditioning equipment in the room, which is very useful. The transparent glass shower room has no door, no ceiling-mounted shower, and no bathtub, just like a domestic guest house.
3. Sands Lobby P34 is indeed like the shadow of the rumored hotel.
4. The possibly expensive accommodation fee is P56 for the sky garden and P789 for the infinity pool. Watching the sunrise and sunset from the infinity pool is really nice.
5. I have stayed in two hotels that are famous for their sense of design, and the experience was particularly poor. Traditional and old hotels are the most comfortable. If there is a next time, I will definitely stay at the Ritz-Carlton at the same price. The front desk service is attentive, and there are many waiters who can speak Chinese. Even if there is a miscommunication, they will find ways to actively solve it.

review_text: Birthday in October and cake to eat in November

review_text:
Thank you to the hotel for making my stay at the Sands Hotel a great experience👍👍👍.
Service: We came with our children to check in in the afternoon. When we saw the long queue, we were a little worried. We were afraid that the baby would cry in the queue. When we were about to get him a toy, the hotel attendant asked us to follow him in. We checked in quickly in the VIP room. Since my English is not good, the waiter Jimmy told me that he could accompany me to help with translation when I was worried. This made me feel that the service of Sands Hotel is very considerate, but this was the beginning of the surprise. When the Ruchelle clerk told me that I could upgrade to a high-rise large room. , I felt that I was really lucky to be in Singapore. After completing the formalities, the attentive Ruchelle asked me if my birthday was that month, and told me that the hotel would give me a birthday gift. These actions not only surprise me, but also express my gratitude to Sands Hotel for its sincere hospitality to its guests.
Hygiene: The hotel bathroom and toilet are very clean and tidy. There are many bath towels and toiletries are all famous brands. The toothbrush is very comfortable and the toothbrush head is elastic and soft.
Environment: Needless to say, the environment of the Sands Hotel is unbeatable. The floor-to-ceiling glass windows overlook the sunset and night view of the entire Marina Bay.

Facilities: The hotel's infinity swimming pool is very good, and it doesn't feel too crowded at any time. It's very comfortable to take pictures and swim.
If I have another chance to come to Singapore next time, I will continue to choose Sands Hotel.

room_type: Sands Premier Double Queen Gardens By The Bay View
review_text: 非常棒的體驗，前台看我們講中文，特地增加了一位中文接待。看到我們帶了兩個小朋友，細心的幫我們把雙大床房升級到了新裝修的家庭房。帶獨立的上下鋪房間，非常貼心的配置，遊戲機，洗衣機，奶瓶🍼清洗台，BB餐椅都有，還給寶寶送了玩具公仔和小童洗漱用品。57樓無邊泳池超讚，6樓廊橋去濱海灣花園很方便，還有接駁電瓶車。8:00商場一樓的噴泉燈光秀也不錯，看完可以去57樓泳池遙望8:45天空樹燈光秀，特別適合我們不願意多走的家庭。樓下地鐵和的士都很方便，風景很美，下次可以帶團隊來體驗！
review_translated: It was a fantastic experience. Seeing we spoke Chinese, the front desk staff added a Chinese-speaking receptionist. Seeing we were traveling with two children, they thoughtfully upgraded our double room to a newly renovated family room. It had separate bunk beds and was thoughtfully equipped with a game console, washing machine, bottle wash station, and baby high chair. They even provided a toy and children's toiletries for the baby. The infinity pool on the 57th floor was amazing, and the 6th-floor bridge was convenient for access to Gardens by the Bay, with a shuttle bus available. The fountain light show on the first floor of the mall at 8:00 AM was also fantastic. Afterward, you could go to the 57th-floor pool to watch the 8:45 PM Skytree light show, perfect for our family who doesn't want to walk too much. The subway and taxis were easily accessible downstairs, and the scenery was beautiful. I'd definitely bring a group to experience it next time!

The infinity pool needs no introduction, it must be praised!

review_text: This time I went to the front desk and paid extra to move to the newly renovated Building 1. It was worth it! The overall decoration, furniture and drinks are very particular and exquisite. It is also the benchmark for luxury hotels today. When booking a hotel, please note that Building 1 and 2 have been renovated, and Building 3 is still the original old decoration, so be sure to confirm.

review_text:
Overall recommended! The public space of the hotel and the surrounding shopping malls and museums are very interesting. There is a complete range of food, drink and entertainment, which is very suitable for vacation.
Facilities: Living in Tower 3, the room feels quite new and not old.
Hygiene: I feel pretty good
Environment: Nice, the scenery is amazing! As a landmark, the hotel has many tourists and staff, but it does not make people feel cluttered; the extra-long infinity pool on the top floor is really beautiful and worth a visit; the restaurant on the top floor has a great view and is also highly recommended
Service: There are many staff who are very enthusiastic and feel very friendly

review_text: The service is really good, the resort environment is very beautiful, the transportation is convenient, and all the staff are very enthusiastic, especially the Underwater World Villa, I will never leave. Will come again next time when I have time.
review_translated: The service is really good, the resort environment is very beautiful, the transportation is convenient, and all the staff are very enthusiastic, especially the Underwater World Villa, I will never leave. Will come again next time when I have time.

review_text:
I have two children of my own and were upgraded to two large beds. The stay was a great experience! Still worth a stay!
The hotel is so big that it takes a long time to get to the swimming pool and gym!
review_translated:
I have two children of my own and were upgraded to two large beds. The stay was a great experience! Still worth a stay!
The hotel is so big that it takes a long time to get to the swimming pool and gym!

review_text:
Amazing hotel. Check-in at 15.00, check-out at 11.00 the next morning.

The pool on the 57th floor is very warm in March, there is a children's area and several Jacuzzis. You can leave your room in a swimsuit and robe, everyone moves between floors like that, no one worries.

We had breakfast on the 1st floor (breakfast until 11.00), a very varied choice.

We also used the room service, ordered alcohol to the room, and everything was delivered promptly.

I definitely recommend staying in Marina Bay for at least one night, it's worth it!

review_text: When traveling as a couple, you must stay at the Landmark Hotel. The five-sided swimming pool on the top floor is very nice.

review_text: In addition to the convenience of **, the facilities are not good, there is no environment, if you are not going to **, other hotels are better than this one for half the price

review_text:
Service: From check-in to departure, every waiter is very nice.
An incident occurred during this period. My suitcase was broken. I thought it was broken by the waiter while carrying it, so I went to the hotel to inquire. The receptionist who came to handle it was very good. Although it was difficult to communicate in English, they would approach the problem from the customer's point of view. Because I had to check out that day and go to USS to play, the hotel offered to give me a temporary suitcase to use as clothing for transfer, and then Responsibility for inquiring items. In the end, it was found that the problem was not the hotel's, but they still gave me temporary repairs.

Room: I chose a harbor view room. I live on the 45th floor. The room is very large and there is a living room where you can directly see the Merlion, the sunset and the light show at night. You can also see the bay garden.

Environment: There are too many reviews for the infinity pool. The sky garden looks a little worse because of the guardrails.

Tips: If you arrive early, you will be given a temporary room card. You can go directly to the infinity pool and sky garden. You can then change the room card when the room is ready. It is very user-friendly. Although the room rate is expensive, it is also worth the money. great experience

review_text:
I made a reservation in advance for yoga starting at 7:30 in the morning, but the staff on the lobby floor told me that it was not in the morning but starting at 5:30 pm, so when I went to the yoga reception desk at 5:30 pm, I was told that it was in the morning, and the staff were not able to communicate with each other, so I ended up not being able to participate in yoga even though I had made a reservation💦It's a shame.
The room I reserved was for 3 people, but it only had one king-sized bed, and even when I called, they never came, so it was a bit of a hassle💦
Also, some rooms with Gardens by the Bay view seemed to be undergoing construction and were very noisy during the day.
Although it was a wonderful hotel, I was disappointed in many ways. . .

review_text:
The Sands Hotel Singapore is located in the landmark of Singapore, enjoying the urban charm of the Lion City in the hinterland of the Bay Area. All kinds of sophisticated tastes, the ultimate incomparable luxury, and expect extraordinary, considerate, and thoughtful honorable services. Luxurious luxury is manifested in every detail.

Jump into the world-famous infinity pool in the sky, overlook the magnificent cityscape, and immerse yourself in a fantasy world full of infinite surprises. Shopping, gourmet food, fun, and accommodation are all here. Extraordinary enjoyment, like no other.

The design starts from the heart, and is born for comfort, tranquility, joy, and enthusiasm. Staying in luxurious rooms or suites, you can also enjoy peace of mind in the bustling city center.

Take a break and enjoy the stunning view. Swim in the world's largest sky infinity pool, as if you are in the sky. What you need and think is close at hand, and you can enjoy a leisurely sense of belonging like home.

Embark on a gourmet journey and taste all kinds of flavors from all over the world. Select high-quality ingredients and cook with passion. Exclusively produced by award-winning restaurant celebrity chefs, taste buds will be completely satisfied on this extraordinary taste journey.

The trend of the season gathers together, world-renowned fashion brands, popular beauty and skin care products, and elegant fashion products gather together. From the latest ready-to-wear and high-end watches to sparkling jewellery, rare wines, find fashion treasures that reflect the most refined taste.

Wander through the immersive exhibits. Indulge in world-class theater performances and concerts. Or take a traditional sampan cruise and cruise on the canal. In addition, well-planned festivals and cultural events are staged throughout the year. Masters of art, music and design make Marina Bay Sands a place of inspiration and exploration.

At Marina Bay Sands, the night never ends. Soaring 57 floors, sip signature cocktails from master mixologists at the outdoor rooftop bar. Dance moves at Singapore's largest nightclub, while internationally renowned DJs play high-energy tunes and control the crowd, partying until dawn.

When you stay at Marina Bay Sands, you can shop, dine, and have fun in it, and you can get endless rewards instantly, and you can get more noble privileges in addition to luxury. Popular events, popular restaurants, Sands Singapore is paradise on earth!

review_text: More than 4,000/night. Such a room makes people want to complain! The hotel room is old and I don’t see the luxury! My mobile phone charging cable and every socket in the straight-board room didn't work, and the slippers were of poor quality. In short, I would never choose this hotel again.
review_translated: More than 4,000/night. Such a room makes people want to complain! The hotel room is old and I don’t see the luxury! My mobile phone charging cable and every socket in the straight-board room didn't work, and the slippers were of poor quality. In short, I would never choose this hotel again.

review_text: The hotel in Building 3 was under renovation upstairs and the noise was loud. There was a long queue at the front desk and it took about an hour to check in. The front desk clerk was not familiar with the business and had not selected a room for half an hour.
review_translated: The hotel in Building 3 was under renovation upstairs and the noise was loud. There was a long queue at the front desk and it took about an hour to check in. The front desk clerk was not familiar with the business and had not selected a room for half an hour.

review_text:
Take the subway bayfront exit B and turn around to reach the lobby. There will be a waiter to help you carry your luggage and then tell you whether to check in at tower 1 or 3. It seemed that they had been upgraded when we went there. They asked us if we wanted to choose a city view room. We decisively chose a city view room. As expected, the view was better than the garden.
The room is large and has all the facilities.
In each tower, you can take the elevator to 55 and then change the elevator to go to the infinity pool. You can just change into your swimsuit before going. The opening hours seem to be 6am-11pm. There are fewer people in the morning, which is great for taking pictures.
The hotel is very convenient to the garden and can also lead to Sands Shopping Mall. It seems that you can go to the Sky Garden for free, but we didn't go because we didn't have enough time. The deposit is 200 Singapore dollars.

review_text: Warm and comfortable, the staff are enthusiastic, full of details, and the accommodation is first-class. Every staff member takes the initiative to help. I used the infinity pool three times in total 🏊 and later I learned that it opens at six o'clock. Awesome! Already announced to all friends and will continue to stay.

review_text:
I love it so much~ My son loved the pool too haha
But it is expensive. Other than the nice view, nice room, and nice swimming pool, what else...should I say this is worth the price? Still, if you made it this far, you could spend at least a day..🤣

review_text: The staff was not very good

review_text: The swimming pool upstairs is great and feels like a vacation.
review_translated: The swimming pool upstairs is great and feels like a vacation.

review_text: Building No. 3 has been undergoing renovation work. It started at 8 o'clock in the morning and went on non-stop. In the meantime, the wall was hammered until 10 o'clock. It was really unacceptable. Moreover, the equipment and facilities were outdated. In fact, to put it bluntly, apart from being famous, it had no merit! There are many other options for that price

review_text: It's a top-class hotel that I always wanted to stay at at least once in my life, but it's also one I'd like to visit again. The check-in service, room service, pool, restaurant, etc. were all surprisingly top notch and made for great memories.
review_translated: It's a top-class hotel that I always wanted to stay at at least once in my life, but it's also one I'd like to visit again. The check-in service, room service, pool, restaurant, etc. were all surprisingly top notch and made for great memories.

review_text: It was a friendly and convenient trip.
review_translated: It was a friendly and convenient trip.

review_text: Warm and comfortable, the staff are enthusiastic, the details are in place and the service is first-class. Especially the infinity pool on the roof is amazing. I have recommended it to my friends and will stay there next time.
review_translated: Warm and comfortable, the staff are enthusiastic, the details are in place and the service is first-class. Especially the infinity pool on the roof is amazing. I have recommended it to my friends and will stay there next time.

review_text: The hotel is now a symbol of Singapore. Stayed overnight to attend a conference at the adjacent convention center. It was very convenient to move around by just using the hallways inside the building. There is a shopping center next door and plenty of restaurants. In addition to mineral water and carbonated drinks, the room had an espresso machine and snacks, and I was very grateful that they were all free. It's also super convenient to be able to order ice or other supplies in your room that are missing on the TV. The view of the city from the infinity pool on the 57th floor and the garden by the bay behind it were spectacular. The restaurant on the 57th floor was also very delicious, the breeze was pleasant, and the atmosphere at night was great. It has been 13 years since we opened in 2010. The room was clean and I was a little surprised that when I opened it with my card key, the curtains opened automatically. The view from the Garden by the Bay side welcomed us. The atmosphere of the room is great, but the impression of the furniture and room is a little faded. After 13 years, it has deteriorated to a certain extent, so I can't help but feel like I'm paying for the scenery. However, when I arrived at the hotel early, I was able to check in, and the bellman who was in charge of my room carried my suitcase and explained the room and the hotel carefully. It was an impression. I didn't see many Japanese guests, but people from other countries seem to love this hotel, and the infinity pool is in the state of potato washing. Other than this hotel, everywhere in Singapore is crowded, so I want you to be prepared for that and enjoy your stay.

The hotel's swimming pool is unparalleled, and the breakfast is also very rich and worth experiencing.

review_text:
The view was great and the room was clean!
Service was great!
I thought it would be nice if there was a sofa or a place to relax at the front desk while waiting for a taxi.

review_text: I don’t know why the Sands Hotel is so popular. The facilities are old, have a musty smell, and are very troublesome. To check in, you have to go to Tower 1 first and then go to the corresponding tower to get the room card. The infinity pool is really disappointing. All in all, I am not very satisfied.

review_text: The hotel itself is very luxurious and huge. But the most emblematic thing, the infinity pool, really disappointed me. Too many people, there is no space to sit because everyone puts their towel on the sunbeds even if they are at the pool. The club next to the pool, packed with people too. To be so expensive, they would have to filter more.

review_text:
I wasn't notified in advance, but the room was under construction.
It was very uncomfortable due to construction noise.

I can't rest in my room
I requested a room change but it was denied.

I paid a million won to come here after hearing noise between floors and the sound of a drill.
I can hear the sound of hammering starting at 9 am.

The bedding was uncomfortable, and there was a musty smell in the hallway.
Breakfast and customer service are worse than Mandarin Oriental.

review_text: The hotel service is very good, and the pretty girl at the front desk also helped us arrange a good room. But to be honest, for this price, the facilities and size of the room are just average. But mainly the swimming pool on the roof plays a big role. Breakfast is average, not very rich. It can only be said that the scenery replaces everything.

review_text: We booked a deluxe king bed room. When we arrived, Jerry at the hotel front desk warmly welcomed us and upgraded us to a suite. The rooms are luxurious and comfortable, and the equipment is very advanced. As soon as you enter the room, the lights and curtains are automatically turned on, facing the sea and the spring flowers blooming. The top floor is an infinity swimming pool, overlooking the scenery of Singapore CBD, which is very beautiful. Thanks to the Ctrip platform and thanks to Jerry at the hotel, we had a great time.

The hotel has a strategic location, convenient transportation and convenient travel. Complete facilities and advanced equipment to meet various needs.
The decoration is exquisite and tasteful. Thank you so much! Next time I come, I’ll choose Sands Hotel

review_text: Traveling with my parents, the two nights in Jinsha were so wonderful! It’s really popular. We checked in at 4pm and the room was still full. There were no vacancies, but the front desk staff was very nice! Let's go to the rooftop swimming pool garden to rest first. The restaurant is really delicious! There was a Mimosa cocktail early in the morning. The Chinese-speaking lady at Lavo restaurant was very nice and introduced me to the food one by one. The guy at the bar was very enthusiastic and came out to help me mix it! In the evening, we went to Spago Bar to show off our fried chicken, beer, ice cream, and it was delicious and not expensive!

review_text: The hotel environment is really good. The hotel swimming pool is really beautiful. I must try it once when I come to Singapore. There was a beautiful Korean lady who helped me check in at the front desk. She was very polite and patient. She helped me a lot by answering my questions. She also gave my child a three-dimensional book with a cartoon version introducing the hotel. The child was very happy and thanked her very much!

review_text: The service is first-rate, the rooftop infinity pool is unmatched, but the price is too high, the price for summer vacation is really shocking, it is worthy of being one of the top few in the world. Everyone said that you have to stay in Singapore.
review_translated: The service is first-rate, the rooftop infinity pool is unmatched, but the price is too high, the price for summer vacation is really shocking, it is worthy of being one of the top few in the world. Everyone said that you have to stay in Singapore.

review_text:
It was a really perfect one night~~
I went alone with my daughter, and they upgraded our room so we stayed in a really nice room~ It wasn't a garden view, but I still liked how open it was~~ It was very clean inside, and when I asked for a towel, it took only a few minutes to get it~~ The staff were also very kind^^ The pool was nice and charming even though it rained~~^^ The night view was really pretty~~ There were a lot of people, but it wasn't so bad that I couldn't take pictures~~

I didn't have time to swim and I was busy the next day, so I couldn't use the dinner buffet that was said to be delicious~~

There were a lot of places to buy things and see at Marina Bay Sands Mall, but I was a little disappointed because I was with my kids~~^^

One night at Marina Bay in Singapore is really a must^^ You should definitely~~ use it!!!

One night at Marina Bay in Singapore is really a must^^ You should definitely~~ use it!!!

review_text: The hotel facilities are old and do not match the appearance of Marina Sands or Singapore’s image and business card.
review_translated: The hotel facilities are old and do not match the appearance of Marina Sands or Singapore’s image and business card.

review_text:
All I can say is - totally sorry for the price. Singapore’s tourism industry is full during the Spring Festival. Everyone knows that services will inevitably be discounted. We are also mentally prepared in this regard.

However, the other five-star hotels I visited during the same period (Maldives and Kuala Lumpur) still have a clear sense of service, and tourists are basically fine if they are a little patient.

The only MBS that costs NT$9,000 per night is out of stock. We spent 60,000 yuan for three rooms for two nights, but we received unsatisfactory service experience everywhere.

On the first day I checked in, I was informed that I had to wait for an hour before I could check in because the room was full. Of course I understood this. But there is no place to stay in the entire hall, not a bench or a sofa. Note: It does not mean that it is occupied by others, but it does not exist at all. Every square meter is given to profitable restaurants and coffee shops. It's okay to let us spend money, but we can't sit in the restaurant because we missed our meal. Every corner is occupied by embarrassed passengers, which reminds me of the Spring Festival Railway Station.

What should we do with our two 80-year-olds? The front desk can only suggest hypocritically that we can go to the food court in the nearby shopping mall to take a seat... Okay. After walking for 20 minutes, I found that the food court was also full. After an embarrassing 15 minutes of waiting, I was finally able to settle down. I was already feeling dissatisfied, so I bought some snacks to calm down my panic and try to think of the best.

An hour later the call came - the room was ready for us to move in. I confirmed again, are all three sets of rooms ready? Everyone set sail again and walked for 20 minutes back to the front desk... ***, in fact, only one room was available. What about the elders? Go back to the food court and take a seat? Speechless.

If you leave a message to express your dissatisfaction, you should also acknowledge that the management takes it seriously and sends you a box of chocolates to express your apology. We don’t want to cause trouble, and we want to be peaceful during the New Year. But every time I interact with hotel staff, I get angry.

- My 15-year-old son went to the swimming pool with my wife without his room card and was refused permission.
- The room card expired the next morning and I had to go to the front desk to reactivate it. This little thing also caused many questions.
- After finishing the buffet and signing the bill, we were told that we were not allowed to leave and had to confirm our identity (not a very friendly tone, but the request was understandable). But after the confirmation, should we come over and tell us that we can leave?

The high-voltage test can only give them a zero score. If you want to enjoy luxury, it is highly recommended to stay next to Ritz, Oriental Mandarin, and Four Seasons. The location is similar, and the service awareness is 100 times stronger.

review_text:
I went to check in at 10 o'clock in the morning. There were not many people. I could store my luggage first and get a temporary card. The luggage would be delivered to the room after the room was ready. I got the room before 2 o'clock in the afternoon. The lights and curtains opened automatically when I opened the door. The area was large, the decoration was very good, and the design was in line with the standards of five stars. Although I saw that many people who booked deluxe rooms online were also upgraded to newly renovated rooms, I was not sure about my luck. Maybe I really didn't want to live in an old room, so I booked a 45-square-meter premium room. But unfortunately, the floor was too low. I only got the 5th floor for a price of just over 10,000 yuan. I could only see the shopping mall opposite, and there was basically no view.
The hotel has good supporting facilities, there is a hotel ** opposite, and there is Marina Bay Gardens behind. The Merlion and the Helix Bridge are within walking distance. The infinity pool and the sky garden are also great.
In addition, the luggage service is very good, the toiletries are a full set of Ferragamo, and the breakfast variety is also very rich👍

review_text: The service is professional and enthusiastic. The supporting facilities are complete! The landscape is first-class! The receptionist at the front desk is professional and humane, worthy of praise 👍The buffet has many dishes and tastes good. We had a great holiday and will stay here again next time. Recommended.
review_translated: The service is professional and enthusiastic. The supporting facilities are complete! The landscape is first-class! The receptionist at the front desk is professional and humane, worthy of praise 👍The buffet has many dishes and tastes good. We had a great holiday and will stay here again next time. Recommended.

review_text: Invincible bay view, the room is very new, the bedding is very comfortable, the children like it very much, tower 3, 45th floor, perfect~
review_translated: Invincible bay view, the room is very new, the bedding is very comfortable, the children like it very much, tower 3, 45th floor, perfect~

review_text: 11號辦理入住並且已經交了按金，塔3辦理是37層，等晚上回房間的時候房間出現了兩個陌生男人入住，立即聯繫了前台，前台態度很是敷衍，保安去了房間查看，並且也聯繫了前台，前台説是系統問題，五星級酒店竟然出現了這種問題，簡直太可笑了，我立馬報警了，似問如果我先入住了，兩位陌生男人後入住，會是什麼樣的結果，安全問題酒店也沒有重視，前台叫了主管經理一直不來，説是在解決更嚴重的問題，難道我的問題不是很嚴重嗎，直到我報警後警察來了之後這個主管經理才來（第一張圖片男的就是那個經理），第二張那個女前台一直不給解決，奉勸大家不要選擇這個酒店，我作為黑鑽會員，一直會追究投訴到底，保證自己的權益。
review_translated: I checked in on the 11th and paid a deposit. Tower 3 is on the 37th floor. When I returned to the room at night, two strange men checked into the room. I immediately contacted the front desk, but their attitude was perfunctory. The security guard went to the room to check and also contacted the front desk. The front desk said it was a system problem. It was ridiculous that a five-star hotel had such a problem. I immediately called the police, asking what would have happened if I checked in first and the two strange men checked in later. The hotel didn't take the security issue seriously. The front desk called the supervisor, but the manager didn't come. They said they were solving a more serious problem. Isn't my problem serious enough? The supervisor manager didn't come until I called the police and the police arrived (the man in the first picture is the manager). The female receptionist in the second picture didn't solve the problem. I advise everyone not to choose this hotel. As a Black Diamond member, I will always pursue the complaint to the end to protect my rights.

review_text: After checking in, I found that the bathroom had not been tidied up. There were leftover cotton pads used by the previous guest. The cotton swabs and shower caps used by the previous guest were not replaced. They did not clean it until the next day after complaining. It is simply the worst place I have ever stayed. A decent hotel. But, one thing to say, the pool is great and the service is also very good.
review_translated: After checking in, I found that the bathroom had not been tidied up. There were leftover cotton pads used by the previous guest. The cotton swabs and shower caps used by the previous guest were not replaced. They did not clean it until the next day after complaining. It is simply the worst place I have ever stayed. A decent hotel. But, one thing to say, the pool is great and the service is also very good.

review_text: The location is great, close to shopping malls and ******. The hotel has a rich breakfast, good facilities, and a great sky pool. I recommend the suite at Sands, which has a good view both during the day and at night. The dinner buffet at Sands is pretty good. But the water in the sky pool needs to be changed more frequently.
review_translated: The location is great, close to shopping malls and ******. The hotel has a rich breakfast, good facilities, and a great sky pool. I recommend the suite at Sands, which has a good view both during the day and at night. The dinner buffet at Sands is pretty good. But the water in the sky pool needs to be changed more frequently.

review_text: Thank you Ctrip for booking, it is very convenient and reliable! The price is also reasonable! Booked a double bed with city view and three breakfasts! The hotel upgraded the suite, which is great! The Golden Sands Hotel is very worth staying in. Now most of the rooms in the hotel have been renovated, very new and very good! And the location is very convenient! Every service staff in the hotel is very warm and polite! There are two places for breakfast, the rise restaurant on the first floor and the lavo restaurant on the 57th floor! I had dinner on the rise on the first floor! The breakfast on the 57th floor, the breakfast is really rich, the waiter who took the seat asked me if I want to drink😅, the breakfast also offers all kinds of wine! In short, Sands is worth staying in!

review_text: Super hotel, accommodation, dining, shopping and entertainment, everything is there! With children and friends, the transportation is also very convenient! Great location to watch National Day fireworks!
review_translated: Super hotel, accommodation, dining, shopping and entertainment, everything is there! With children and friends, the transportation is also very convenient! Great location to watch National Day fireworks!

review_text: Nothing wrong with it except expensive
review_translated: Nothing wrong with it except expensive

review_text: Everything is average, from check in to check-in experience! There are three buildings in Sands, No. 1 and No. 2 are newly renovated, and No. 3 is unrenovated. When booking on Ctrip, the building is not informed, and the on-site processing depends on luck (I don’t know if it will be treated differently)! Friends are so lucky 💥Free upgrade to the VIP suite in Building 1, which is super big and has newer facilities!

review_text: Very bad experience! Poor service! The room is old! The floor booked on Ctrip is super low! You can obviously go to the 57th floor to eat, but you lied to my husband and children that you can only eat on the first floor! Not recommended to stay

review_text:
Great experience, worthwhile trip. I regret that one night is too little. I should stay a few more nights. The cake sent by the hotel is delicious and rich in chocolate
Facilities: The facilities are a bit old but well maintained. The infinity swimming pool is 1.2 meters. There is a children's pool next to it. It is 0.5 meters. There are three sizes of children's life jackets
Hygiene: very clean
Environment: a word beautiful
Service: Home away from home

review_text: The hotel has perfect facilities, considerate service, shopping, entertainment and gourmet food. The scenery is invincible, and the infinity pool is the icing on the cake. The hotel room has first-class landscape, garden view, city view... You can have a panoramic view of Singapore...
review_translated: The hotel has perfect facilities, considerate service, shopping, entertainment and gourmet food. The scenery is invincible, and the infinity pool is the icing on the cake. The hotel room has first-class landscape, garden view, city view... You can have a panoramic view of Singapore...

review_text: The Sands Hotel is a landmark in Singapore, although the price is very expensive, it is worth it. The room is large and the sea view is very beautiful. What's more worth mentioning is the infinity pool upstairs. Overall, all services are also very good.
review_translated: The Sands Hotel is a landmark in Singapore, although the price is very expensive, it is worth it. The room is large and the sea view is very beautiful. What's more worth mentioning is the infinity pool upstairs. Overall, all services are also very good.

review_text: The must-visit online celebrity hotel in Singapore, the price is also affordable for ordinary people, it is still possible to stay for one or two nights. The check-in time is written at 15 o'clock, but you can check in in the morning. After the procedures are completed, you will be given a temporary card, you can go to the top floor and so on, and you will call when the room is ready. We checked in at 11 o'clock, and we called to inform us that we could move in as soon as we walked to the Science Museum. After we visited the Science Museum, we went to the shopping center in the third district to buy lunch and then went back to the hotel to eat. There are various luxury stores, restaurants, and theaters in the shopping center in the third district. The basement floor is a food court. There are dozens of stores that are not duplicated, and the prices are reasonable, but there are too many people and it is difficult to find a seat. There are also separate restaurants on the upper floors, such as Cantonese cuisine, steak, Vietnamese cuisine, etc. The environment is better and the price is more expensive. There is also a **** on the basement level, which can be entered for free with a passport and entry form. There is also a subway station on the basement level, and the bus on the ground is also very convenient. There are Merlion Park, Ferris Wheel, and other scenic spots around, you can walk there or take a few bus stops. The room itself is okay, it is rare in this price range without a bathtub, only a shower. There are coffee machines, water heaters, a lot of drinking water, about seven or eight bottles, and free drinks and snacks. The TV is the largest in the hotel I have stayed in, it should be 75 inches. The noise problem is very serious. The hotel is located in the middle of the driveway, and there is a constant flow of vehicles throughout the day. There are also a lot of vehicles at 3 in the morning, and the accelerator is still on. Those who have poor sleep quality must wear earplugs, and may not sleep well all night. The most important selling point is the infinity swimming pool on the top floor. Wear a swimsuit in your own room, take the elevator to the 57th floor, and need to take the elevator once in the middle. You have to swipe your room card when you take the elevator and enter the swimming pool, one person at a time, so there are several room cards Bring them all. You can take large bath towels at the entrance, you can take two, one for the other. You can sit on any empty chairs, and you can go into the water after you put your things down. The scenery is indeed beautiful, and the surrounding scenery is unobstructed. Everyone is taking pictures, and I am the only one swimming. The pool above the No. 3 tower is an adult pool, and children under the age of 16 are not allowed to enter, so it is relatively quieter. If you take your children to the No. 1 and No. 2 pools, it is more lively. The waiter will ask around with the menu. If you want to order drinks, beer and snacks, you can ask the waiter to order. Sometimes the waiter will hold a bullet cup with a drink or fruit in it, just one bite, that is free and you can eat it with confidence. There are several restaurants next to the swimming pool. You need to wear good clothes to enter. Some restaurants still require reservations. You can ask the front desk for details. There are several high-end restaurants on the first floor of the hotel. The per capita cost is about 1,000 yuan, and reservations are required. Those who want to eat should book in advance. Overall, it’s a pretty good hotel. The number one online celebrity hotel in Singapore is a must-go hotel. The room is as good as the high-rise with a good view, and the lower-floor infinity pool can be used for more bubbles.

room_type: Sands Premier Double Queen Gardens By The Bay View
review_text: It's beyond words. So nice.
review_translated: It's beyond words. So nice.

review_text: I can only say that it refreshed my understanding.
review_translated: I can only say that it refreshed my understanding.

review_text:
1. There are a lot of people when we come here, and we queue up to check in. During the period, we will give you free water and candies. There is also a little brother at the front desk named Han, who is very nice. He gave the children a picture book, upgraded a big suite, and looks very handsome. oh! And patience! Helped me to register as a Sands member, and I found it very convenient when shopping later! Thank you Han physically and mentally!
2. Thank you Han for arranging our room on the 52nd floor. It is very convenient to swim and view the scenery on the 57th floor. Snacks in the room are free~
3. The breakfast is very good, you can choose by yourself. We choose to be next to the swimming pool on the 57th floor. You can enjoy swimming while having breakfast
4. There is a bar next to the swimming pool. If you don’t swim, enjoy the night view at the bar near the railing. It’s great, and the service staff are great~ Good location with minimum consumption

5 areas for improvement~ The room is very large, but it feels relatively simple haha

review_text: The service is really considerate, and the scenery is really beautiful. It was my first time seeing the infinity pool, and I was still shocked. Shopping and dining are very convenient downstairs, and it is definitely worth staying in Singapore.
review_translated: The service is really considerate, and the scenery is really beautiful. It was my first time seeing the infinity pool, and I was still shocked. Shopping and dining are very convenient downstairs, and it is definitely worth staying in Singapore.

review_text: The Jinsha Hotel, which I booked very early, arranged a room on an average floor in T3. The size of the room facilities did not match the room price at all. It was not even equipped with the basic children's bathrobes and toiletries. It was a very disappointing stay!
review_translated: The Jinsha Hotel, which I booked very early, arranged a room on an average floor in T3. The size of the room facilities did not match the room price at all. It was not even equipped with the basic children's bathrobes and toiletries. It was a very disappointing stay!

review_text:
Sands Hotel wins super five-star rating👍

review_text:
The service, cleanliness, and everything in the hotel was perfect! I was supposed to have booked a lower floor, but I was upgraded and the view was absolutely beautiful.
We stayed for 2 nights and would like to stay for more! You can vacation without leaving the hotel.

We stayed for 2 nights and would like to stay for more! You can vacation without leaving the hotel.

review_text: The best hotel I have ever stayed in, the service attitude is great, the buffet is very delicious, the infinity swimming pool is very good, and there is a heated pool. The night view of Singapore is particularly beautiful at night. If you go to Singapore, you really need to stay at the Sands.
review_translated: The best hotel I have ever stayed in, the service attitude is great, the buffet is very delicious, the infinity swimming pool is very good, and there is a heated pool. The night view of Singapore is particularly beautiful at night. If you go to Singapore, you really need to stay at the Sands.

review_text:
When visiting Singapore, I highly recommend staying at least one night at Marina Bay Sands. I was assigned a newly renovated garden view room, which allowed me to enjoy the Supertree Show in a comfortable setting. I also took some memorable photos at the infinity pool on the 57th floor.
I was also able to choose between breakfast on the ground floor and the 57th floor.
There's so much to see and eat at the mall, I even spent a whole day there, but it wasn't enough time. It's a great place for families, couples, or anyone else.
I'll definitely stay here again next time I'm in Singapore.
review_translated:

I was also able to choose between breakfast on the ground floor and the 57th floor.
There's so much to see and eat at the mall, I even spent a whole day there, but it wasn't enough time. It's a great place for families, couples, or anyone else.
I'll definitely stay here again next time I'm in Singapore.

room_type: Sands Premier Double Queen Gardens By The Bay View
review_text: The facilities are good, but the price is too high

review_text: We arranged T3, a room on the 43rd floor. There was a firework show on Saturday night, which was directly opposite, but we missed it when we went to a friend's house for dinner. The front desk can basically check-in smoothly. The details are that there are two breakfast places, one on the top floor and one on the first floor, you can choose. It was told by another front desk who can speak Chinese. The sound of the air conditioner fan is relatively loud, but everything else is good, and we were given double snacks and drinks. There are many people in the rooftop swimming pool in the afternoon, and even more people in the evening

review_text: It is no exaggeration to call it the ceiling of the hotel industry, the invincible swimming pool, invincible vision, perfect experience. Booked two rooms, one is a corner room with a large balcony of 20 square meters, facing the Gardens by the Bay, and the other is a suite, facing the Merlion. The first choice for family vacations in Singapore.

review_text: Waiting in line for breakfast, check-in is also a line, there are a lot of people, the garden view is really amazing, but the price is too expensive, it can't be more expensive, it's just an experience. Singapore hotels are really expensive.

review_text: Expensive but worth every penny. The hotel upgraded the room type and the experience was particularly good. The infinity pool on the top floor is an unforgettable experience for the whole family and must not be missed. I will stay here again next time I come to Singapore.
review_translated: Expensive but worth every penny. The hotel upgraded the room type and the experience was particularly good. The infinity pool on the top floor is an unforgettable experience for the whole family and must not be missed. I will stay here again next time I come to Singapore.

review_text: A great hotel, worthy of being a landmark building in Singapore. Ctrip is awesome, the hotel upgraded the room for free, I like it. The hanging garden outside the window and the bay in the distance, ships, and fighter jets can be seen. The scenery is invincible. Standing on the balcony, I am reluctant to sleep. Wherever you go, there are scenery. There is a food court near the hotel, 7 minutes walk, I like it very much. Go to the aerial cable car, the Merlion, and it's just a short walk away. Check-in is usually done at 3:00 p.m., and the room will be cleaned. You will be given a temporary card to swim in the infinity pool on the 57th floor. You can get the room card when you get a call. There are many varieties of early dining, and the dishes are exquisite, which is great.

I could move in in advance and live on the 45th floor. Because I don't speak English, they will find someone who can communicate with me and talk to me, which is very convenient. The point is that the night view is beautiful, the room I live in has a beautiful view, and I would like to stay again next time. Breakfast is also delicious 😋

review_text:
I requested a connecting room and received a reply, but on the day I was told that it was not available.
There were no vacant rooms nearby, so the two rooms were separated.
I showed them the email we exchanged and the name of the person in charge was written there, but I was told on the day that they had not responded (the person who handled my check-in on the day was a Japanese man, not the person who responded). )
I made a reservation early but it was no good.

review_text: I read reviews before saying that the room was small and old, but when I arrived, I was so pleasantly surprised. The room was large and exquisite, and the service was attentive. The infinity pool was definitely worth the price. My baby refused to leave after staying for two days.

The infinity pool was definitely worth the price. My baby refused to leave after staying for two days.

review_text: The Indian lady at the front desk has a very good attitude and upgraded the room. Unfortunately, I don’t remember the name. You must go to the hotel swimming pool. The view of Marina Bay is also quite invincible!

review_text:
設施：酒店內部設施不怎麼樣，非常普通，甚至比不上一兩千一晚的五星級酒店，金沙比利茲卡爾頓還要貴，非常失望

衞生：剛拿到房卡一進房間就一股發黴的臭味，我們馬上聯繫了客房部，他們説是馬上安排人過來處理，結果等了一會，來了個人帶了個像空氣加濕器一樣的東西説先插上，看有沒有改善，如果沒有他們再做處理。我就納悶，你這明顯就是地毯沒處理好，一股發黴的臭味就這小機器能有什麼用，我也沒多説，趕着出去吃飯，就出門了。等到晚上回房間的時候，一打開門，一股刺鼻的香水味，我才知道，他們就是這樣處理的，我帶着一個兩歲的娃，這刺鼻的香水味我聞着都頭疼，孩子怎麼睡呢？於是我馬上打電話聯繫換房，酒店給安排換到了49樓的另一個房間，這個房間裏雖然沒有那股黴臭味了，但是49樓一整層都是一股塑膠的臭味，説不出來的感覺，就像剛從樹上割下的乳膠，反正很難聞，我半夜好幾次被這個味道臭醒

環境：房間很舊，很舊很舊很舊，根本不值這個價錢，並且房間內各種東西看起來都很low，除了電梯看起來高級一點，其他的都無力吐槽，我去澳門凼仔隨便一個酒店都比他這個強多了，最奇葩的是，馬桶旁邊居然沒有洗屁股的噴頭，我的天吶


服務：這是唯一能接受的，就是他們的服務很好，有求必應，但是有點怪的是，很多中國員工，前台辦入住的是中國人，客房打掃的也是中國人，説英文他們都聽不懂，都是中國北方的普通話口音。

這是今生第一次住這個酒店，也是最後一次。
五千多一晚，生日佈置還需要自費，就這麼幾個氣球，收了大約750元人民幣，呵呵呵。
review_translated: Facilities: The hotel's interior facilities were not very good, very ordinary, not even comparable to five-star hotels costing one or two thousand yuan a night. The Sands is even more expensive than the Ritz-Carlton, which was very disappointing. Cleanliness: As soon as we got our room card and entered the room, we were greeted by a musty smell. We immediately contacted housekeeping, and they said they would send someone to take care of it. After a while, someone arrived with what looked like a humidifier and said they'd plug it in and see if it improved. If not, they'd come back. I was puzzled, thinking, "It's obvious the carpet isn't properly maintained. What good is a small device for a musty smell?" I didn't say much, rushing out to dinner, so I left. When I returned to the room that night and opened the door, I was greeted by a pungent perfume. I realized this was how they treated it. With a two-year-old in tow, the pungent perfume gave me a headache. How could the child sleep? So I immediately called to change rooms, and the hotel arranged to move me to another room on the 49th floor. Although this room didn't have the moldy smell, the entire floor was filled with a plastic odor. I can't describe it, like latex freshly cut from a tree. It was terrible. I was woken up several times in the middle of the night by the smell. Environment: The room was very old, very old, very old. It was not worth the price at all. Everything in the room looked very low-end. Except for the elevator, which looked a little more upscale, I can't complain about anything else. Any hotel I went to in Taipa, Macau was much better than this one. The most bizarre thing was that there was no shower head next to the toilet to wash your butt. Oh my god. Service: This is the only acceptable thing. Their service is very good and responsive. But it's a bit strange that many of the staff are Chinese. The front desk check-in staff is Chinese, and the housekeepers are also Chinese. They can't understand English when I speak. They all speak Mandarin with a northern Chinese accent. This is my first time staying at this hotel in my life, and it will also be my last. It costs more than 5,000 yuan per night, and you have to pay for the birthday decorations yourself. Just for a few balloons, it cost about 750 yuan, haha.

review_text: Very satisfied. The hotel upgraded us to a newly renovated room on the T1 floor. You can enjoy the view of Gardens by the Bay from the bed. The infinity pool on the 57th floor is also amazing. The kids had a great time

review_text: There is nothing to say about the room, environment, or facilities. It deserves to be a first-class hotel. However, the hotel garden view room booked on Ctrip was stated to be from the 10th to 40th floors, and the room assigned to me was on the 8th floor. Although it was a bit low, after reporting it, I said that Ctrip promised it. It has nothing to do with the hotel. If you want to upgrade, you need to pay extra. Since you booked it with Ctrip, the room rate is also fully paid, so the room should be reserved. If you can't do it with Ctrip, don't write it in vain!

My wife and children are very happy!

review_text: 5000元一晚的新加坡金沙酒店，還不含早餐，非常不值，房間裝修非常簡單，房間面積還較小，洗手間更小，洗手枱小的可憐，沖涼房和馬桶間沒有門，洗澡水流到外面，水漫金山，作為父親上個廁所都不方便，生怕被孩子看到。沖涼房的花灑是固定的，給孩子洗澡也不方便，如何做一家親子酒店呢？以後都不會再來住金沙，沒有性價比。建議親子家庭千萬不要選這家酒店。
review_translated: At 5,000 yuan a night, and not including breakfast, the Marina Bay Sands Singapore is a complete waste of money. The rooms are simply decorated and small, and the bathrooms are even smaller, with a tiny sink. There's no door between the shower and toilet, so the shower water leaks out, flooding the entire hotel. Even as a father, I struggled to use the restroom, fearing my child might see me. The showerhead is fixed, making it difficult to bathe my child. How can this be considered a family-friendly hotel? I won't be staying at the Marina Bay Sands again. It's simply not worth the money. Families with children should definitely avoid this hotel.

review_text: On April 23, I stayed at the long-awaited Marina Bay Sands, Singapore, which is known as the world's top hotel. The room given to us at the beginning (tower 3-1628, see pictures 1, 2, and 3) made me extremely disappointed and angry. This room is a deluxe double room booked on Ctrip. It costs more than 5,000 yuan per night. According to visual inspection, it is only a dozen square meters. The facilities are old and aging, and they are not even equipped with the basic facilities of five-star hotels such as weighbridges and bathtubs. I don't think even the 3-star hotels in China can reach it, so dare to charge for 7-star hotels. After complaining to Ctrip that I couldn’t change the room, I had to communicate directly with the hotel management. After 5 minutes, I decided to change room 1086 in Tower 2, which was newly renovated 4 months ago (Figure 4-9). With fully automatic remote control facilities in the room, and 100$ as dinner fee, this room can be given 5 stars. Therefore, should Ctrip Overseas Department be mainly responsible for this very unpleasant experience? Ctrip must make an explanation and other follow-up matters, otherwise it will be suspected of defrauding consumers. When our own people do not fight for the interests or rights of our own people, we must not compromise easily. Finally, I would like to thank the hotel manager Cai, Sherman Chua, who solved the problem efficiently and properly for me).
review_translated: On April 23, I stayed at the long-awaited Marina Bay Sands, Singapore, which is known as the world's top hotel. The room given to us at the beginning (tower 3-1628, see pictures 1, 2, and 3) made me extremely disappointed and angry. This room is a deluxe double room booked on Ctrip. It costs more than 5,000 yuan per night. According to visual inspection, it is only a dozen square meters. The facilities are old and aging, and they are not even equipped with the basic facilities of five-star hotels such as weighbridges and bathtubs. I don't think even the 3-star hotels in China can reach it, so dare to charge for 7-star hotels. After complaining to Ctrip that I couldn’t change the room, I had to communicate directly with the hotel management. After 5 minutes, I decided to change room 1086 in Tower 2, which was newly renovated 4 months ago (Figure 4-9). With fully automatic remote control facilities in the room, and 100$ as dinner fee, this room can be given 5 stars. Therefore, should Ctrip Overseas Department be mainly responsible for this very unpleasant experience? Ctrip must make an explanation and other follow-up matters, otherwise it will be suspected of defrauding consumers. When our own people do not fight for the interests or rights of our own people, we must not compromise easily. Finally, I would like to thank the hotel manager Cai, Sherman Chua, who solved the problem efficiently and properly for me).

review_text: It's a very famous hotel. The sheets and quilts smell like stinky feet when I sleep at night. The room is not big, the TV is super big, and the bathroom is not user-friendly. Go shopping at Sands opposite. There are no street signs in the center. The breakfast costs 52 per person. There are very few types of mostly Western food. There is no hot noodle soup suitable for Chinese food. The rooftop swimming pool is just for enjoying the view from the top of the building. In fact, the swimming pool is not big and it is not interesting. If you don’t consider the high-altitude scenery, it will feel the same as an ordinary swimming pool. It will be boring to play for half an hour. There are very few Chinese-speaking waiters in the hotel. If you check in in the morning, you have to wait until after 3 pm to go to the room. You have to wait for the hotel's email notification. Travel is inconvenient. The price/performance ratio is not recommended.

review_text: It was upgraded and was room of garden view of high-rise floor. The scenery in the morning and evening was beautiful and the best. The inside of the hotel was really beautiful, and the grandeur of the lobby was a masterpiece. The shopping mall is so big that I almost got lost many times. From the hotel to the Merlion, I felt comfortable walking around while appreciating the cityscape. I could see the hotel from anywhere, and it was truly a symbol of Singapore! I created a membership card for free at the shopping mall, and I had a kiss back for the amount I bought, and I ate lunch and breakfast at the food court for that amount. However, when I went shopping again two days after checkout, I heard from a store clerk that I could receive points for the cost of my stay. We went to the legendary pool, but it was a bit cold and we didn't stay in it for too long. The scenery on the city side can be seen from the pool and observatory, so I thought it was good to stay on the botanical garden side.

review_text: A very scary thing was that when I came back from swimming, the room door could not be opened and the safety chain inside was locked. It felt like there was someone inside. I can't say it's bad because I didn't book a newly renovated room. It's just that at such a high price, people have higher expectations. The swimming pool scenery is unbeatable and the kids love it.

Not worth the price, many domestic hotels are better than this

review_text:
The garden view room type is high floor, the scenery is really great, you can directly watch the garden light show at night (the concert is very quiet) Italian-style capsule coffee/juice/biscuits are provided in the room, the TV is big and it is cool to watch movies, and the electric curtains let natural light Wake you up, there will be no mosquitoes with the windows on the upper floors, the only downside is that there is no bathtub.

The infinity pool needs to be reserved in advance, and free cones/juices are provided…
But it is recommended to soak in the morning/evening. In the afternoon, it will be really super dry in the west, and the water will become warm🤣
If there is thunder this time, tourists will be invited to go ashore immediately and leave the outdoor area (including loungers). After the storm, the swimming pool will be opened again, which is very safe.

review_text: It's my first trip to Singapore, and I have the strongest memory of the Marina Bay Sands Hotel in my 3 nights and 5 days trip to Singapore. I went to a family of 4 and 2 rooms with garden view for a total of 2 million won, so I had a lot of worries, but I have no regrets:) My parents loved it when they first arrived at the hotel, so it was even better!🥹 And the infinity pool was as good as its reputation! I was able to swim while looking at the city view, and I swam once more in the afternoon, evening, and morning on the day I checked in:) Do a lot of swimming~~~ There is also a jacuzzi, so if it's cold, you can go in. I was a bit cold because it rained and ice cream They didn't even give me a drink. It's connected to a shopping mall in the basement, and I don't know the names of famous restaurants like Kaya Toast and Chili Crab, but there were those restaurants, and there are so many of them!!! There are all famous coffee houses and milk tea houses! And I was lucky enough to have a Korean staff help me when I checked in, so it was great :)

The pool water is also a bit dirty. The facilities are average. But if you come to Singapore, you should visit it at least once.
review_translated: The hotel location is good and the staff are mostly friendly. However, because there are so many customers, the response is a bit slow. And the bedding smelled a bit. The pool water is also a bit dirty. The facilities are average. But if you come to Singapore, you should visit it at least once.

review_text: Not to mention the scenery, the hotel facilities are old, and the wallpaper is bubbling. The shower water in the bathroom is very thin. Service is ok.
review_translated: Not to mention the scenery, the hotel facilities are old, and the wallpaper is bubbling. The shower water in the bathroom is very thin. Service is ok.

review_text:
I was able to feel the pride of a building built in Korea.
The location was good and the amenities were also very good.
I chose the harbor view, and the scenery overlooking Garden by the Bay and the sea was really beautiful.
review_translated:
I was able to feel the pride of a building built in Korea.
The location was good and the amenities were also very good.
I chose the harbor view, and the scenery overlooking Garden by the Bay and the sea was really beautiful.

review_text: It was a symbolic hotel, so there were a lot of people. There were a lot of people and there were a lot of staff, so it felt a little crazy. The staff were friendly and the view was great. The facilities are also very good.
review_translated: It was a symbolic hotel, so there were a lot of people. There were a lot of people and there were a lot of staff, so it felt a little crazy. The staff were friendly and the view was great. The facilities are also very good.

review_text: Before the epidemic, there were two breakfast restaurants. At that time, the price was half cheaper than it is now. Breakfast is more abundant. Now many of the previous dishes are gone. Before the epidemic, the most expensive price was SGD 600-700. Now the cheapest price is more than SGD 800. The price is really It's too expensive, I feel that the price of a hotel in Singapore is too high
review_translated: Before the epidemic, there were two breakfast restaurants. At that time, the price was half cheaper than it is now. Breakfast is more abundant. Now many of the previous dishes are gone. Before the epidemic, the most expensive price was SGD 600-700. Now the cheapest price is more than SGD 800. The price is really It's too expensive, I feel that the price of a hotel in Singapore is too high

review_text: I haven't received the bill 4 days after I left the store. After asking, I told the hotel that my information could not be found? 😨. If you want to make a complaint and do not provide an open channel to make a direct complaint, you need to convey it to their commissioner. Response to customer opinions and complaint management is not transparent enough, morality is not coordinated!
review_translated: I haven't received the bill 4 days after I left the store. After asking, I told the hotel that my information could not be found? 😨. If you want to make a complaint and do not provide an open channel to make a direct complaint, you need to convey it to their commissioner. Response to customer opinions and complaint management is not transparent enough, morality is not coordinated!

review_text:
It is the best hotel in the world.
I only stayed for one night, but next time I come to Singapore.
I will be staying here for all my itineraries.
review_translated:
It is the best hotel in the world.
I only stayed for one night, but next time I come to Singapore.
I will be staying here for all my itineraries.

review_text:
The first choice for vacation travel, famous attractions in Singapore👍🏻👍🏻👍🏻
The swimming pool is very good, the service is very good, the room is a bit old, but it is big in Singapore
review_translated:
The first choice for vacation travel, famous attractions in Singapore👍🏻👍🏻👍🏻
The swimming pool is very good, the service is very good, the room is a bit old, but it is big in Singapore

review_text: Very good, you guys!
review_translated: Very good, you guys!

review_text: It's a pity that there is no bathtub, but the facilities are good.
review_translated: It's a pity that there is no bathtub, but the facilities are good.

review_text: The best hotel without words! I think this is a hotel you must go to when you go to Singapore! The staff are so friendly and nice too!
review_translated: The best hotel without words! I think this is a hotel you must go to when you go to Singapore! The staff are so friendly and nice too!

review_text: The low floors are very noisy, there are many people, and the service is poor
review_translated: The low floors are very noisy, there are many people, and the service is poor

review_text: The excellent hotel. The staff the best I have cidto. The impressive pool. Very good service in general and very uenn breakfast.
review_translated: The excellent hotel. The staff the best I have cidto. The impressive pool. Very good service in general and very uenn breakfast.

review_text: It's a good hotel whenever I come. I want to go again. It's a waste of money.
review_translated: It's a good hotel whenever I come. I want to go again. It's a waste of money.

review_text:
Good
Marina Bay in the front, Gardens the Bay in the back. It is a good place to plan a trip and take a walk because it is a famous spot in front and back.
There is a sands mall, so it's good to kill time.
In addition to the rooftop pool, admission to the SkyPark is free.
Guests can enter through the swimming pool instead of queuing to enter the Sky Park, so there is no line when going up and down.
The room is spacious and comfortable, but just plain interior + amenities...
I don't use a bathtub, but anyway, there was no bathtub in that large space.
It was on the 21st floor, not a high floor, but the view was great.
Honestly, almost everything else is normal, 80% of the room price is for the pool, 10% is for the gym, and the rest is pure room price...

Bad
After checking in at 3:00 (not checking in, you have to check in to check in), it took about an hour and 10 minutes to check in and come up to the room. (It's 4:30) - Worst...
Before going to the pool, you have to make a reservation by scanning QR in advance, and you have to go up and check the text message to enter.
There are separate elevators for low floors and high floors, so you have to change elevators once in the middle to go up to the rooftop pool from the 21st floor.
review_translated:
Good
Marina Bay in the front, Gardens the Bay in the back. It is a good place to plan a trip and take a walk because it is a famous spot in front and back.
There is a sands mall, so it's good to kill time.

It was on the 21st floor, not a high floor, but the view was great.
Honestly, almost everything else is normal, 80% of the room price is for the pool, 10% is for the gym, and the rest is pure room price...

After checking in at 3:00 (not checking in, you have to check in to check in), it took about an hour and 10 minutes to check in and come up to the room. (It's 4:30) - Worst...
Before going to the pool, you have to make a reservation by scanning QR in advance, and you have to go up and check the text message to enter.
There are separate elevators for low floors and high floors, so you have to change elevators once in the middle to go up to the rooftop pool from the 21st floor.

review_text: Overall very good
